  <section class="introduction container-fluid">
   <div class="row margin-btm2">
    <div class="col-md-10 col-lg-8 col-md-offset-1 col-lg-offset-2 text-center">
     <h2 class="section-title">
     </h2>
     <h1>
      The world is becoming more digital. Can you keep up with its security and privacy needs?
     </h1>
     <p>
      SECCLO is an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree programme in the field of computer science, in information security and cloud computing. We combine practical engineering skills with a strongly research-based curriculum. The emphasis is on combining strong security knowledge with hands-on R&D skills in a specific technical area, cloud computing.
     </p>
     <p>
      Our consortium consists of six highly ranked technical universities in Finland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Estonia, and France. SECCLO aims is to educate highly professional engineers to meet both the immediate hiring requirements and the long-term needs of the European ICT industry.
     </p>
     <p>
      Becoming a SECCLO student is a life-changing experience for our students:
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       “World-class academics, great classes, beautiful campus, and the best student life I could ever imagine.”
      </span>
      <br/>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       “I enjoyed every bit of my time here. Vibrant student life, great teachers and helpful people all around. Couldn’t have asked for more!”
      </span>
      <br/>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       “The staff is supportive, with everything you need help with, the student culture is outstanding. I am so glad that I made the decision to be part of this programme.”
      </span>
     </p>
     <h2>
      Join us now to change your life forever!
     </h2>

  <section class="introduction container-fluid">
   <div class="row margin-btm2">
    <div class="col-md-10 col-lg-8 col-md-offset-1 col-lg-offset-2 text-center">
     <h2 class="section-title">
     </h2>
     <h1>
      The world is becoming more digital. Can you keep up with its security and privacy needs?
     </h1>
     <p>
      SECCLO is an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree programme in the field of computer science, in information security and cloud computing. We combine practical engineering skills with a strongly research-based curriculum. The emphasis is on combining strong security knowledge with hands-on R&D skills in a specific technical area, cloud computing.
     </p>
     <p>
      Our consortium consists of six highly ranked technical universities in Finland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Estonia, and France. SECCLO aims is to educate highly professional engineers to meet both the immediate hiring requirements and the long-term needs of the European ICT industry.
     </p>
     <p>
      Becoming a SECCLO student is a life-changing experience for our students:
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       “World-class academics, great classes, beautiful campus, and the best student life I could ever imagine.”
      </span>
      <br/>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       “I enjoyed every bit of my time here. Vibrant student life, great teachers and helpful people all around. Couldn’t have asked for more!”
      </span>
      <br/>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       “The staff is supportive, with everything you need help with, the student culture is outstanding. I am so glad that I made the decision to be part of this programme.”
      </span>
     </p>
     <h2>
      Join us now to change your life forever!
     </h2>
     <div>

 <head>
  <meta charset="utf-8"/>

  <title>
  </title>

  <style type="text/css">
   /* HEADINGS ETC. */
		a,
		.container-fluid h1, 
		.container-fluid h2, 
		.container-fluid h3, 
		.container-fluid h4, 
		.container-fluid h5 {
			color:#ffffff !important;
		}
		a:hover,a:active {
			color:#f7f7f7;
		}
		.section-title {
			border-bottom: 2px solid #ffffff;
		}
		.subheader {
			color:#f7f7f7		}

		/* HEADER */
		.header-sub {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);   
		}
		.header-mob {
	       background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%); 
		}
		
		/* PARTNERS */
		.partners {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);			
		}
		.partners h2, 
		.partners h3, 
		.partners h4, 
		.partners h5 {
			color:#00c1d5;
			border-color:#00c1d5;
		} 
		.partners.white_bg {
			background:#fff;
		}
		.partners.white_bg h2, 
		.partners.white_bg h3, 
		.partners.white_bg h4, 
		.partners.white_bg h5 {
			color: #ffffff;
			border-color: #ffffff;
		}
		/* GRADIENT BLOCKS */
		.gradient-bg {
			background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);
			color:#fff;
		}
		.gradient-bg h1,
		.gradient-bg h2,
		.gradient-bg h3, 
		.gradient-bg h4,
		.gradient-bg h5,
		.gradient-bg a {
			color:#00c1d5;
			border-color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.gradient-bg .btn {
			color: #00c1d5;
			border: 2px solid #00c1d5;
		}

		/* HERO */
		.hero {
			background-image: url('../img/glider.jpg');
		}
		.hero-content h1, 
		.hero-content a, 
		.hero-content-mob h1 {
			color:#00c1d5 !important; 
		}
		.hero-content-mob p {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.hero-content {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.hero-content .btn, 
		.hero-content-mob .btn {
			border:2px solid #00c1d5;
			color:#00c1d5 !important;

		}
		.navbar-header a {
			color: #00c1d5; 
		}
		.hero .copyright {
			color: #f0f0f0;
		}
		.hero-content-wrapper {
			background: rgba(255,255,255,0.6);
		}
		.hero-content-mob {
			background: linear-gradient(75deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);   
		}

		/* NAV */
		.container-fluid .nav>li>a:hover, 
		.container-fluid .nav>li>a:focus,
		.container-fluid .nav li a:hover, 
		.container-fluid .nav li a:active, 
		.nav li a:focus {
			background:rgba(255,255,255,0.2);
		}
		.icon-bar {
			background: #00c1d5;
		}
		.top-nav {
			background: #f7f7f7;
		}
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a,
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a:hover,
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a:focus {
			background:rgba(255,255,255,0.2);
		}
		.top-nav .nav li a,
		.top-nav .navbar-brand {
			color:#00c1d5 !important;

		}
		.top-nav .container-fluid .nav li a:hover {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu .active a,
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu .active a:hover {
			background: #efefef;
		}
		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li:active,
		.dropdown-menu li.current-menu-item,
		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li {
			background: #efefef;
		}
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a:hover,
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li:active a:hover {
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}

		.btn.btn-primary {
			background-color:#ffffff;
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}
		.btn.btn-primary:hover {
			background-color:#f7f7f7;
		}
		footer {
			background: #00c1d5;
		}
		.nav .open a {
			background: #f7f7f7;
		}
		@media only screen and (max-width: 767px) {

			.top-nav .dropdown-menu {
				background: #efefef;
			}
			.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a {
				background:transparent;
			}
		}

		/* Product title */
		.product-title__secondary-title {
			color: #ffffff;
		}
  </style>

    <div class="col-md-8 content">
     <h2>
      Programme
     </h2>
     <div class="subheader">
      <p>
       SECCLO focuses on two specific aspects of modern computing systems, cloud computing and information security.
      </p>
     </div>
     <p>
      <em>
       Cloud computing
      </em>
      means in a broad sense highly distributed and scalable computation and data storage in data centers as well as physically accessible devices.
      <em>
       Information security
      </em>
      means protection of computation, communication and data from unauthorized access.
     </p>
     <p>
      SECCLO responds to the demand for professional engineers who are able to innovate and build the next generation cloud and mobile computing services and applications. The emphasis on combining strong security knowledge with hands-on R&D skills in a specific technical area, cloud computing, is a special characteristic of SECCLO.
      <img alt="" class="alignnone wp-image-634" data-pagespeed-url-hash="756247277" decoding="async" height="100%" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2018/10/263d2c79-301435_aalto_secclo_liikkuvuuskuva_bigger-font-1024x721.jpg" srcset="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2018/10/263d2c79-301435_aalto_secclo_liikkuvuuskuva_bigger-font-1024x721.jpg 1024w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2018/10/263d2c79-301435_aalto_secclo_liikkuvuuskuva_bigger-font-300x211.jpg 300w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2018/10/263d2c79-301435_aalto_secclo_liikkuvuuskuva_bigger-font-768x541.jpg 768w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2018/10/263d2c79-301435_aalto_secclo_liikkuvuuskuva_bigger-font-700x493.jpg 700w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2018/10/263d2c79-301435_aalto_secclo_liikkuvuuskuva_bigger-font-640x451.jpg 640w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2018/10/263d2c79-301435_aalto_secclo_liikkuvuuskuva_bigger-font-1600x1127.jpg 1600w" width="100%"/>
     </p>
     <h3>
      Mobility scheme and joint summer activities
     </h3>
     <p>
      The first year of the SECCLO curriculum is offered by Aalto University. The second year will be completed at one of the other consortium universities: KTH, NTNU, DTU, UT or EURECOM. The final project, Master’s thesis, is written under the joint supervision of both the first- and second-year university.
      <strong>
       The language of instruction in all universities is English.
      </strong>
     </p>
     <p>
      At the end of the first academic year, we offer a joint one-week summer school for all first year SECCLO students. This complements the curriculum offered by the entry and exit universities by introducing the most recent and up-to-date topics in the information security field. It also serves as a networking and feedback event for all students before they move to exit universities. A summer internship is taken at one of the programme’s industry partners or in an applied research project in June-August before the second year studies.
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       SECCLO programme requires full-time study on campus (some lecture courses are online).
      </strong>
     </p>
     <p>
      <a href="https://secclo.eu/programme/first-year-curriculum/">
       Read more about first-year studies >>
      </a>
      <br/>
      <a href="https://secclo.eu/programme/second-year-curriculum/">
       Read more about specialization studies for the second year >>
      </a>
     </p>
     <h3>
      Learning outcomes
     </h3>
     <p>
      SECCLO aims to educate professional engineers who are able to take on the most demanding R&D tasks and drive the development of future products and services. More specifically, the learning outcomes are the following:
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Students have the theoretical understanding of information security and practical skills for designing and critically analysing secure computing systems.
      </li>
      <li>
       Students understand the architectural principles of distributed services and applications. They are able to design, analyse, and implement cloud-based and distributed computing systems.
      </li>
      <li>
       Students have in-depth knowledge of their chosen specialization area and can apply it to solving technical and scientific problems. They are able to contribute to the knowledge and practices in their field.
      </li>
      <li>
       Students have strong software development skills and other technical and professional skills that enable them to take responsible roles in an industrial research and development environment, and they are qualified to continue to doctoral studies in academia.
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h3>
      Qualifications awarded
     </h3>
     <p>
      SECCLO graduates receive two officially recognized Master of Science degrees (120 ECTS) issued by the entry and exit university (two national degrees, double degree). The degrees are awarded upon successful completion of the two-year programme.
     </p>
     <table border="1" cellpadding="1" cellspacing="1" class="aalto-responsive-table has-header">
      <thead style="background: #00c1d5;">
       <tr>
        <th scope="col">
         Institution
        </th>
        <th scope="col">
         Title of Degree Awarded
        </th>
       </tr>
      </thead>
      <tbody>
       <tr style="background: #f2f2f2;">
        <td data-label="Institution">
         Aalto University, Finland
        </td>
        <td data-label="Title of Degree Awarded">
         Master of Science (Technology), Diplomi-insinööri
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td data-label="Institution">
         The Royal Institute of Technology (KTH), Sweden
        </td>
        <td data-label="Title of Degree Awarded">
         Degree of Master of Science (120 credits), Teknologie Masterexamen (120 hp)
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr style="background: #f2f2f2;">
        <td data-label="Institution">
         The Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU)
        </td>
        <td data-label="Title of Degree Awarded">
         Master of Science in Security and Cloud Computing
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td data-label="Institution">
         Technical University of Denmark (DTU)
        </td>
        <td data-label="Title of Degree Awarded">
         Master of Science in Engineering
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr style="background: #f2f2f2;">
        <td data-label="Institution">
         <p align="left">
          University of Tartu, Estonia
         </p>
        </td>
        <td data-label="Title of Degree Awarded">
         Master of Science in Engineering (Computer Science), Tehnikateaduse magister (informaatika)
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td data-label="Institution">
         EURECOM (co-deliverance with Institut Mines Télécom), France
        </td>
        <td data-label="Title of Degree Awarded">
         Diplôme National de Master en Sciences, Technologies, Santé, Mention Informatique Spécialité Sécurité numérique conférant le grade de Master, Master of Science in Computer Science (Specialisation in Digital Security)
        </td>
       </tr>
      </tbody>
     </table>
     <h3>
      Post-graduate studies
     </h3>
     <p>
      The Master of Science degrees awarded provide eligibility for doctoral studies. SECCLO graduates can apply for doctoral studies in any of the consortium universities, other universities in consortium countries or abroad. At the consortium universities, suitable doctoral programmes include:
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Aalto University:
       <a href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/study-options/aalto-doctoral-programme-in-science-0" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        Doctoral Programme in Science
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       KTH:
       <a href="https://www.kth.se/en/eecs/utbildning/forskarutbildning-1.801893" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        Doctoral programmes in School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       NTNU:
       <a href="https://www.ntnu.edu/studies/phisct" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        PhD Programme in Information Security and Communication Technology
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="https://www.ntnu.edu/studies/phcos" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        PhD Programme in Computer Science
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       DTU:
       <a href="https://www.compute.dtu.dk/english/phd/phd-school" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        PhD School Programme at DTU Compute
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       University of Tartu:
       <a href="https://reaalteadused.ut.ee/en/content/doctoral-center-page-faculty-science-and-technology" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        PhD Programmes
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       EURECOM:
       <a href="http://www.eurecom.fr/en/teaching/doctoral-program" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        Doctoral Program
       </a>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      To learn more about post-graduate opportunities for SECCLO students, visit
      <a href="https://secclo.eu/programme/careers-and-employability/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       Careers and employability
      </a>
      .
     </p>
    </div>
   </div>

  <meta content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1" name="viewport"/>
  <link href="apple-touch-icon.png" rel="apple-touch-icon"/>
  <style type="text/css">
   /* HEADINGS ETC. */
		a,
		.container-fluid h1, 
		.container-fluid h2, 
		.container-fluid h3, 
		.container-fluid h4, 
		.container-fluid h5 {
			color:#ffffff !important;
		}
		a:hover,a:active {
			color:#f7f7f7;
		}
		.section-title {
			border-bottom: 2px solid #ffffff;
		}
		.subheader {
			color:#f7f7f7		}

		/* HEADER */
		.header-sub {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);   
		}
		.header-mob {
	       background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%); 
		}
		
		/* PARTNERS */
		.partners {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);			
		}
		.partners h2, 
		.partners h3, 
		.partners h4, 
		.partners h5 {
			color:#00c1d5;
			border-color:#00c1d5;
		} 
		.partners.white_bg {
			background:#fff;
		}
		.partners.white_bg h2, 
		.partners.white_bg h3, 
		.partners.white_bg h4, 
		.partners.white_bg h5 {
			color: #ffffff;
			border-color: #ffffff;
		}
		/* GRADIENT BLOCKS */
		.gradient-bg {
			background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);
			color:#fff;
		}
		.gradient-bg h1,
		.gradient-bg h2,
		.gradient-bg h3, 
		.gradient-bg h4,
		.gradient-bg h5,
		.gradient-bg a {
			color:#00c1d5;
			border-color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.gradient-bg .btn {
			color: #00c1d5;
			border: 2px solid #00c1d5;
		}

		/* HERO */
		.hero {
			background-image: url('../img/glider.jpg');
		}
		.hero-content h1, 
		.hero-content a, 
		.hero-content-mob h1 {
			color:#00c1d5 !important; 
		}
		.hero-content-mob p {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.hero-content {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.hero-content .btn, 
		.hero-content-mob .btn {
			border:2px solid #00c1d5;
			color:#00c1d5 !important;

		}
		.navbar-header a {
			color: #00c1d5; 
		}
		.hero .copyright {
			color: #f0f0f0;
		}
		.hero-content-wrapper {
			background: rgba(255,255,255,0.6);
		}
		.hero-content-mob {
			background: linear-gradient(75deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);   
		}

		/* NAV */
		.container-fluid .nav>li>a:hover, 
		.container-fluid .nav>li>a:focus,
		.container-fluid .nav li a:hover, 
		.container-fluid .nav li a:active, 
		.nav li a:focus {
			background:rgba(255,255,255,0.2);
		}
		.icon-bar {
			background: #00c1d5;
		}
		.top-nav {
			background: #f7f7f7;
		}
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a,
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a:hover,
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a:focus {
			background:rgba(255,255,255,0.2);
		}
		.top-nav .nav li a,
		.top-nav .navbar-brand {
			color:#00c1d5 !important;

		}
		.top-nav .container-fluid .nav li a:hover {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu .active a,
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu .active a:hover {
			background: #efefef;
		}
		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li:active,
		.dropdown-menu li.current-menu-item,
		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li {
			background: #efefef;
		}
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a:hover,
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li:active a:hover {
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}

		.btn.btn-primary {
			background-color:#ffffff;
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}
		.btn.btn-primary:hover {
			background-color:#f7f7f7;
		}
		footer {
			background: #00c1d5;
		}
		.nav .open a {
			background: #f7f7f7;
		}
		@media only screen and (max-width: 767px) {

			.top-nav .dropdown-menu {
				background: #efefef;
			}
			.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a {
				background:transparent;
			}
		}

		/* Product title */
		.product-title__secondary-title {
			color: #ffffff;
		}
  </style>

     <h2>
      First-year curriculum
     </h2>
     <div class="subheader">
      <p>
       The first year of the SECCLO programme (60 ECTS) consists of common studies (50-56 ECTS), summer school (2-5 ECTS) and internship (2-5 ECTS).
      </p>
     </div>
     <h3>
      Curriculum
     </h3>
     <p>
      The first year of the programme (60 ECTS) at Aalto University covers the fundamental concepts, methods and latest technologies on
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       secure systems engineering
      </li>
      <li>
       distributed application development
      </li>
      <li>
       network and service architectures
      </li>
      <li>
       ubiquitous computing
      </li>
      <li>
       cloud and mobile computing platforms
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      Students are also able to choose specialized courses on topics such as network and mobile platform security, computer networking, verification, and data mining.
     </p>
     <p>
      The teaching methods combine theory with hands-on exercises and software development on cloud platforms and mobile devices. Students practice writing and presentation skills and learn to follow the latest research.
     </p>
     <p>
      The joint first year of the SECCLO studies at Aalto University conclude with a summer school and summer internship.
     </p>
     <p>
      The academic year at Aalto University is divided into five periods: I and II (autumn) and III, IV and V (spring).
     </p>
     <p>
      <a href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/programmes/masters-programme-in-security-and-cloud-computing-secclo/curriculum-2024-2026" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       More information available in Aalto University’s website.
      </a>
     </p>
     <p>
      New curriculum for 2024-2026 is published here on 2 April 2024.
     </p>

     <h2>
      Language courses
     </h2>
     <div class="subheader">
      <p>
       SECCLO students are encouraged to learn and use local European languages during their studies. For this purpose, SECCLO consortium universities offer various language courses for students.
      </p>
     </div>
     <p>
      <img alt="" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-4678" data-pagespeed-url-hash="1215275489" decoding="async" height="100%" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" sizes="(max-width: 1200px) 100vw, 1200px" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/c338a3c0-secclo-students-26_photo-igor-vaisanen_kasakkamedia.jpg" srcset="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/c338a3c0-secclo-students-26_photo-igor-vaisanen_kasakkamedia.jpg 1200w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/c338a3c0-secclo-students-26_photo-igor-vaisanen_kasakkamedia-300x198.jpg 300w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/c338a3c0-secclo-students-26_photo-igor-vaisanen_kasakkamedia-768x506.jpg 768w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/c338a3c0-secclo-students-26_photo-igor-vaisanen_kasakkamedia-1024x675.jpg 1024w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/c338a3c0-secclo-students-26_photo-igor-vaisanen_kasakkamedia-700x461.jpg 700w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/c338a3c0-secclo-students-26_photo-igor-vaisanen_kasakkamedia-640x422.jpg 640w" width="100%"/>
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Aalto University, Finland
       <br/>
      </strong>
     </p>
     <p>
      A mandatory advanced communication course in English is part of degree requirements (
      <a href="https://sisu.aalto.fi/student/courseunit/otm-740130d8-e2fc-4efb-b668-3d82e868baff/brochure" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       LC-1310
      </a>
      Academic Communication for MSc Students, 3 ECTS), but students who have excellent command of English may choose 3 ECTS credits of Finnish courses instead. For more information on compulsory language studies for SECCLO students at Aalto University, please see
      <a href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/programmes/masters-programme-in-security-and-cloud-computing-secclo/curriculum-2022-2024#3-first-year-studies" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       here
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      In addition to SECCLO courses and compulsory language courses, SECCLO students can take Finnish and Swedish language courses for free, and have the possibility to take the course LC-7003 Survival Finnish Online (1 ECTS) before arrival to Finland.
      <a href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/language-and-communication-studies/finnish-as-a-second-language-and-as-a-foreign-language" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       Please see Finnish courses here
      </a>
      and
      <a href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/language-and-communication-studies/swedish#2-swedish-for-international-students" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       Swedish courses here
      </a>
      for international students. Possibility to take courses in other languages (Chinese, French, German, Portugese, Russian, Spanish) depends on the language of instruction of the specific course.
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       KTH, Sweden
       <br/>
      </strong>
     </p>
     <p>
      Swedish language courses are not organized by KTH, but instead
      <a href="https://learningswedish.se/courses/1">
       Learning Swedish
      </a>
      free online course is highly recommended for all international students. Credits will not be reported for the course.
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       NTNU, Norway
      </strong>
     </p>
     <p>
      A Norwegian language course (15 ECTS) is offered at NTNU free of charge for all international students. The application deadline is June 1
      <sup>
       st
      </sup>
      for the Autumn semester, and November 1
      <sup>
       st
      </sup>
      for the Spring semester.
      <a href="https://www.ntnu.edu/norwegiancourse">
       Please find more information about the Norwegian course here
      </a>
      , including how to apply, detailed course information, etc.
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       DTU, Denmark
      </strong>
     </p>
     <p>
      <a href="https://speakspeak.dk/danish-courses/at-dtu/">
       Speak
      </a>
      School of Danish offers Danish module courses at all levels for DTU students. One module course is free of charge for the SECCLO students.
      <a href="https://www.dtu.dk/english/education/student-guide/studying-at-dtu/danish_language_courses">
       Please read more about Danish courses here
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       UT, Estonia
      </strong>
     </p>
     <p>
      Estonian language courses are offered by the College of Foreign Languages and Cultures during the semester. The student can select one elective course (up to 6 ECTS) of Estonian language as part of the degree.
      <a href="https://keel.ut.ee/en/Estonian-Language-Courses" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       Please see list of Estonian courses at UT here
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       EURECOM, France
      </strong>
     </p>
     <p>
      A mandatory language course is part of degree requirements (1 ECTS) – French is compulsory for students whose initial level is below B1. For those with a level B1 and above in French, any foreign languages can be chosen to validate this.
     </p>
     <p>
     </p>

      <img alt="" data-pagespeed-url-hash="1190007361" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2018/10/d19bea7e-aalto.png"/>
     </a>
    </li>

 <head>
  <meta charset="utf-8"/>
  <meta content="IE=edge,chrome=1" http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible"/>
  <title>
  </title>
  <meta content="" name="description"/>
  <meta content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1" name="viewport"/>
  <link href="apple-touch-icon.png" rel="apple-touch-icon"/>
  <style type="text/css">
   /* HEADINGS ETC. */
		a,
		.container-fluid h1, 
		.container-fluid h2, 
		.container-fluid h3, 
		.container-fluid h4, 
		.container-fluid h5 {
			color:#ffffff !important;
		}
		a:hover,a:active {
			color:#f7f7f7;
		}
		.section-title {
			border-bottom: 2px solid #ffffff;
		}
		.subheader {
			color:#f7f7f7		}

		/* HEADER */
		.header-sub {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);   
		}
		.header-mob {
	       background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%); 
		}
		
		/* PARTNERS */
		.partners {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);			
		}
		.partners h2, 
		.partners h3, 
		.partners h4, 
		.partners h5 {
			color:#00c1d5;
			border-color:#00c1d5;
		} 
		.partners.white_bg {
			background:#fff;
		}
		.partners.white_bg h2, 
		.partners.white_bg h3, 
		.partners.white_bg h4, 
		.partners.white_bg h5 {
			color: #ffffff;
			border-color: #ffffff;
		}
		/* GRADIENT BLOCKS */
		.gradient-bg {
			background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);
			color:#fff;
		}
		.gradient-bg h1,
		.gradient-bg h2,
		.gradient-bg h3, 
		.gradient-bg h4,
		.gradient-bg h5,
		.gradient-bg a {
			color:#00c1d5;
			border-color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.gradient-bg .btn {
			color: #00c1d5;
			border: 2px solid #00c1d5;
		}

		/* HERO */
		.hero {
			background-image: url('../img/glider.jpg');
		}
		.hero-content h1, 
		.hero-content a, 
		.hero-content-mob h1 {
			color:#00c1d5 !important; 
		}
		.hero-content-mob p {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.hero-content {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.hero-content .btn, 
		.hero-content-mob .btn {
			border:2px solid #00c1d5;
			color:#00c1d5 !important;

		}
		.navbar-header a {
			color: #00c1d5; 
		}
		.hero .copyright {
			color: #f0f0f0;
		}
		.hero-content-wrapper {
			background: rgba(255,255,255,0.6);
		}
		.hero-content-mob {
			background: linear-gradient(75deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);   
		}

		/* NAV */
		.container-fluid .nav>li>a:hover, 
		.container-fluid .nav>li>a:focus,
		.container-fluid .nav li a:hover, 
		.container-fluid .nav li a:active, 
		.nav li a:focus {
			background:rgba(255,255,255,0.2);
		}
		.icon-bar {
			background: #00c1d5;
		}
		.top-nav {
			background: #f7f7f7;
		}
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a,
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a:hover,
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a:focus {
			background:rgba(255,255,255,0.2);
		}
		.top-nav .nav li a,
		.top-nav .navbar-brand {
			color:#00c1d5 !important;

		}
		.top-nav .container-fluid .nav li a:hover {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu .active a,
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu .active a:hover {
			background: #efefef;
		}
		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li:active,
		.dropdown-menu li.current-menu-item,
		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li {
			background: #efefef;
		}
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a:hover,
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li:active a:hover {
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}

		.btn.btn-primary {
			background-color:#ffffff;
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}
		.btn.btn-primary:hover {
			background-color:#f7f7f7;
		}
		footer {
			background: #00c1d5;
		}
		.nav .open a {
			background: #f7f7f7;
		}
		@media only screen and (max-width: 767px) {

			.top-nav .dropdown-menu {
				background: #efefef;
			}
			.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a {
				background:transparent;
			}
		}

		/* Product title */
		.product-title__secondary-title {
			color: #ffffff;
		}
  </style>

    <div class="col-md-8 content">
     <h2>
      Summer school
     </h2>
     <div class="subheader">
      <p>
       First year of the SECCLO programme concludes with a summer school.
      </p>
     </div>
     <pre><img alt="" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-4690" data-pagespeed-url-hash="4150502841" decoding="async" height="100%" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" sizes="(max-width: 1200px) 100vw, 1200px" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/d6842425-ntnusommerskolesightseeing-5090.jpg" srcset="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/d6842425-ntnusommerskolesightseeing-5090.jpg 1200w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/d6842425-ntnusommerskolesightseeing-5090-300x200.jpg 300w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/d6842425-ntnusommerskolesightseeing-5090-768x512.jpg 768w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/d6842425-ntnusommerskolesightseeing-5090-1024x683.jpg 1024w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/d6842425-ntnusommerskolesightseeing-5090-700x467.jpg 700w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/d6842425-ntnusommerskolesightseeing-5090-640x427.jpg 640w" width="100%"/>Sightseeing tour during NTNU Summer School 2019, Photo: Thor Nielsen</pre>
     <h3>
      Summer School (2-5 ECTS)
     </h3>
     <p>
      In the SECCLO Summer School students work as groups on a timely topic in information security. The school is organized during the summer at the end of the first study year by one of the partner universities or other organization. The first SECCLO Summer School in May 2019 was organized by NTNU on the topic of
      <em>
       Blockchain Technologies
      </em>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      Students will prepare for the summer school by forming groups and reading provided material that consists of research literature. During the summer school, the students will start a group project which they will complete after the summer school. All SECCLO students are required to participate in the summer school.
     </p>
     <p>
      The learning goals of the summer school depend on the annual topic. Every year, there are also the following goals:
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Students are able to work in a goal-oriented way as members of a group both locally and remotely (online).
      </li>
      <li>
       Students can plan and manage their own work and take responsibility for delivering the results.
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h3>
      6th SECCLO Summer School on Cybersecurity and Privacy (CySeP), KTH, Stockholm, Sweden (2024)
     </h3>
     <h3>
      5th SECCLO Summer School on Malware Analysis, Vierumäki, Finland (2023)
     </h3>
     <p>
      The fifth SECCLO Summer School will be organized in Vierumäki, Finland, during 29.5.-2.6.2023. Responsible professors: Davide Balzarotti EURECOM and Simone Aonzo EURECOM
      <br/>
      Visiting scholars: Giovanni Lagorio (University of Genoa) and Lorenzo Maffia (United Nations International Computing Centre)
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Course description
      </strong>
     </p>
     <p>
      This introductory course aims to provide both the basic concepts and good practices to analyze malicious executable files for the Windows operating system. The course begins with a brief presentation and how the labs and exercises will be conducted, followed by a summary of the history of malware and its evolution. Then, we proceed to present both the capabilities of attackers and their objectives to help students identify particular Indicator Of Compromise (IoC) in the samples that will be analyzed during the course. The course will then describe the steps required to analyze a suspicious sample, followed by a sandbox setup, namely a safe environment for dynamically executing samples (e.g. drakvuf). Using the tools and methodologies provided in the first part of the school, the rest of the course will focus on the two main types of analysis: static and dynamic. Each phase will include both a theoretical and a technical part. The theoretical lectures, however, will also include practical exercises to understand the class’s content better and gain manual dexterity with the tools presented and installed in the virtual laboratory. Finally, each day will end with a recap session in which the instructors present the solution to assigned exercises.
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Learning methods and activities
      </strong>
      <br/>
      A practical involvement of every course participant is mandatory. Approximately one month before the start of the school, every participant will receive introductory material on the above topic and a set of simple, preliminary exercises. During the course, participants will receive hands-on assignments that aid the teaching of practical aspects.
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Grading
      </strong>
      <br/>
      80% Exercises assigned during the hands-on parts of the course 20% Participation in class discussion and activity
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Recommended previous knowledge
      </strong>
      <br/>
      Linux Command line familiarity. Basic knowledge of C language (e.g., syntax, compilation, memory model). Basic knowledge of Python
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Course materials
      </strong>
      <br/>
      Online material will be provided for all participants
     </p>
     <h3>
      4th SECCLO Summer School in Cyber Security in e-Governance, TalTech, Tallinn, Estonia (2022)
     </h3>
     <p>
      The fourth SECCLO Summer School was organized in TalTech, Estonia during 31.7.-5.8.2022. Students worked on their preparatory online Starter-Kit before the summer school.
     </p>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <strong>
        >>Read more about 4th SECCLO Summer School (2 ECTS)
       </strong>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Course description
       </strong>
      </p>
      <p>
       The program has a focus on e-Governance and Cyber Security lectures from practitioners working in public and private sector. During the program participants will learn how the ecosystem of e- services was built in Estonia so that there are only two things left that a local citizen cannot do online: getting married and getting divorced. The lecturers will explain how e-Estonia was the target of first nation-wide cyber-attack in 2007, how surviving this has transformed e-Estonia into strong cyber-security nation and what is being done daily to mitigate the attacks before and after they might happen. From the start-up and e-service creation side, the program will cover the topics of design process, business model validation and will approach lecturers from successful CyberTech companies. The program has a focus on business innovation and entrepreneurship, there is no need to have specific technical background to join our Summer School.
      </p>
      <p>
       During the first part of the week, participants will learn about legal aspects of egovernance and the requirements for electronic identity, authentication, document exchange and interoperability. In the middle of the week, one day (8 hour long) hands-on cyber exercises will be organized with mentors and experts for improving practical skills and  understanding about the cybersecurity domain. In the second part of the week, experts will explain how the e-Estonian ecosystem works and how critical information infrastructure is protected in the public sector. Finally, participants will be gathered with first hand experience with cyber incidents and offensive security.
      </p>
      <p>
       The program has practitioners from e-Governance Academy, Information Systems Authority, Cyber Defense Unit, CERT-EE and NATO Cooperative Cyber Defense Center of Excellence (CCDCOE). From the private sector, cyber security experts will be invited to share their practical knowledge in different fields, from information security management to RedTeaming operations. Global players grown from Estonia such as GuardTime, SpectX and BOLT will be approached.
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Learning outcomes
       </strong>
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        Get the competence: Learn how disruptive technologies in cyber security have an impact on markets, businesses, and governance and how business models are changing.
       </li>
       <li>
        Get the confidence: Learn the different stages of the technology development process and how to turn a business idea into a viable go-tomarket proposal.
       </li>
       <li>
        Get the soft skills: Teamwork with peers and multidisciplinary professionals, tools and real business challenges will help students implement learning tools.
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Learning methods and activities
       </strong>
      </p>
      <p>
       As a participant in the Summer School, participants will work in teams and apply “learning by doing” to develop a mindset and skills for innovation and entrepreneurship. Participants will take this opportunity to learn and network with mentors, professors and professional intrapreneurs from the business and innovation community. A practical involvement of every course participant is mandatory. Approximately one month before the start of the school, every participant will receive introductory material on Innovation and Entrepreneurship. This is meant to level up the knowledge of all participants. During the course, participants will receive hands-on assignments that aid the teaching of practical aspects.
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Grading
       </strong>
      </p>
      <p>
       50% Challenges assigned during the hands-on parts of the course and participation in class discussion
      </p>
      <p>
       50% Final report
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Course materials
       </strong>
      </p>
      <p>
       Online material will be provided for all participants.
      </p>
     </details>
     <h3>
      3rd SECCLO Summer School in Binary Exploitation Techniques, EURECOM (2021)
     </h3>
     <p>
      The third SECCLO Summer School was organized online due to the ongoing pandemic.
     </p>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <strong>
        >>Read more about 3rd SECCLO Summer School (5 ECTS)
       </strong>
      </summary>
      <p>
       Time: preparatory work 5 – 25 May 2021, intensive period 25 – 28 May 2021, French language and culture workshops by Insitut Français de Finlande 4 – 24 May 2021
      </p>
      <p>
       Responsible Teacher: Professor Davide Balzarotti, EURECOM, France
      </p>
      <p>
       Visiting scholars: Yanick Fratantonio (CISCO), Mariano Graziano (CISCO), Giovanni Lagorio (University of Genoa)
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Course description:
       </strong>
       <br/>
       The main goal of the summer school is to introduce the students to program binary exploitation techniques. The course in divided in four days. The first day will be dedicated to cover material on binary analysis, reverse engineering, debugging, and on the use of Python to script different analysis tasks. The second day will focus on the development of shellcodes and on understanding other techniques used during real attacks. Day three will then be dedicated to the detection and exploitation of security bugs affecting modern software (e.g., memory corruption and integer overflows), modern security mechanisms that have been introduced to prevent their abuse, and to the counter-techniques that are used to bypass such mechanisms. The topics of these first three days are presented for Intel 32 and 64bits CPU architectures, while the final day of the course will introduce the differences (in terms of reversing, shellcoding, and exploitation) on ARM. Special emphasis will be given to the practical aspects of these topics. Each day will start with a morning session in which an instructor will present background material in the form of slides and demos. The day will then continue with a number of practical exercises, in which students (in small groups or alone) will solve challenges of incremental complexity in a Capture-the-Flag-like setting. Finally, each day will end with a recap session in which the instructor will present the solution of the assigned exercises.
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Learning outcomes:
       </strong>
       <br/>
       After completion of this course, students will have acquired the following knowledge:
       <br/>
       -How to use modern tools and extensions to analyze program binaries, reverse engineer their code, and debug their behavior;
       <br/>
       -Understanding of a variety of software security bugs (e.g., memory corruption, integer overflows, and logic errors)
       <br/>
       -Understanding of real-world security mechanisms and bypasses
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Skills:
       </strong>
       <br/>
       – Reverse engineer and debug Linux binaries
       <br/>
       – Uncover vulnerabilities
       <br/>
       – Gain code execution by exploiting these vulnerabilities and bypass security mechanisms
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Learning methods and activities
       </strong>
       <br/>
       A practical involvement of every course participant is mandatory. Approximately one month before the start of the school, every participant will receive introductory material on the above topic and a set of simple, preliminary exercises. During the course, participants will receive hands-on assignments that aid the teaching of practical aspects.
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Grading:
       </strong>
       <br/>
       80% Challenges assigned during the hands-on parts of the course
       <br/>
       20% Participation in class discussion and activity
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Recommended previous knowledge:
       </strong>
       <br/>
       – Basic knowledge of Linux environment (e.g., command line programs)
       <br/>
       – Basic knowledge of C (e.g., compilation, memory model)
       <br/>
       – Basic knowledge of Python
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Course materials:
       </strong>
       <br/>
       Online material will be provided for all participants.
      </p>
     </details>
     <h3>
      2nd SECCLO Summer School in Cyber Security
      <strong>
       (2020)
       <br/>
      </strong>
     </h3>
     <p>
      Due to COVID-19 situation, the second summer school was organized online. The topic of the summer school was cyber security.
     </p>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <strong>
        >>Read more about 2nd SECCLO Summer School 14.4.-3.5.2020: Cyber Security (5 ECTS)
       </strong>
      </summary>
      <p>
       Time: 14 April – 3 May 2020, intensive period 25 April – 3 May 2020
       <br/>
       Responsible teachers: Professor Tuomas Aura, Doctoral candidate Jacopo Bufalino
       <br/>
       Credits: 5 ECTS
       <strong>
        <br/>
       </strong>
       Location: online
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Background
       </strong>
      </p>
      <p>
       The curriculum of the SECCLO Erasmus Mundus program includes an annual summer school, where the students are expected to work as groups on a timely topic in information security. Due to the COVID-19 epidemic, the summer school had to be cancelled on a short notice. The summer course on cyber security is primarily a replacement for the cancelled event, and its learning goals remain unchanged. Since the course was implemented online, we were able to invite other students majoring in security to join the course.
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Learning goals
       </strong>
      </p>
      <p>
       After this course, the students have experience of offensive security analysis. They understand the penetration testing process against Windows and Linux based computer systems and know the most common tools and techniques. They are familiar with several types of security vulnerabilities in server and desktop systems. They are also able to identify and critically analyze potential new vulnerabilities. They can communicate and discuss with security professionals and are aware of the latest trends in security analysis. In the project part, the students plan their own work and carry it out in a goal-oriented way as members of a group. They use online tools for remote collaboration and presentation of the results.
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Course implementation
       </strong>
      </p>
      <p>
       The course consists of penetration testing exercises, which are done in an online platform; guest talks and discussion meetings; and a group project with a demo on vulnerability analysis. The course starts with a two-week preparation period with preliminary exercises and project work. The highlight of the course is a nine-day intensive period with daily online meetings for discussion and guest talks and collaborative penetration testing exercises. The course ends with demos and presentations of the project work.
      </p>
      <p>
       The exercises are based on a carefully selected set of penetration-testing labs from the commercial
       <em>
        Hack The Box (HTB)
       </em>
       platform. The regular university learning platforms are used for distributing the materials, Zoom is used for the meetings, and Microsoft Teams for continuous communication among the course staff and students. During the intensive period, the course staff engages in the collaborative hacking, monitors the students’ progress, and is continuously available for guidance. The students are encouraged to help each other in an atmosphere of cooperation rather than competition.
      </p>
     </details>
     <h3>
     </h3>
     <h3>
      1st SECCLO Summer School in
      <strong>
       Blockchain Technologies, NTNU, Norway (2019)
      </strong>
     </h3>
     <p>
      The first summer school was organized in Trondheim, Norway, in the premises of Norwegian University of Science and Technology. The summer school focused in Blockchain Technologies.
     </p>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <strong>
        >>Read more about 1st SECCLO Summer School 20.5-24.5.2019: Blockchain Technologies (5 ECTS)
       </strong>
      </summary>
      <p>
       Organizing university: NTNU – Norwegian University of Science and Technology, Department of Information Security and Communication Technology, Trondheim
      </p>
      <p>
       Responsible professor: Professor Danilo Gligoroski
      </p>
      <h4>
       Course description
      </h4>
      <p>
       This course will provide conceptual understanding of Blockchain as a public distributed database (distributed ledger) that records its immutable transactions through transparent consensus using secure cryptographic techniques. Blockchain is considered as a disruptive technology due to its impact on our modern digital society, especially in the areas of currencies and financial services, banking, contracting, governmentally regulated legal relations, identity management and anonymity and many others. This course will cover in details the blockchain operations and functionality. It will also cover current innovative directions in Blockchain technologies, opportunities and challenges.
      </p>
      <h4>
       Learning outcomes
      </h4>
      <p>
       After completion of this course, students will have the following:
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Knowledge:
       </strong>
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        What is blockchain
       </li>
       <li>
        The structure of a blockchain
       </li>
       <li>
        How blockchain works, its underlying concept of transactions, blocks, proof-of-work, consensus building and its cryptographic building blocks
       </li>
       <li>
        Advantages and limitations of blockchain vs traditional techniques
       </li>
       <li>
        How decentralized and distributed blockchain ledger maintains its transparency, and guarantees privacy, anonymity, security and immutability
       </li>
       <li>
        How cryptocurrencies work
       </li>
       <li>
        What are “smart” contracts
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Skills:
       </strong>
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        Practical understanding of how cryptocurrencies are implemented
       </li>
       <li>
        How to launch a new blockchain introducing a new cryptocurrency
       </li>
       <li>
        How to mine a cryptocurrency
       </li>
       <li>
        How to form and join mining pools
       </li>
       <li>
        How to use blockchain for applications other than cryptocurrency
       </li>
      </ul>
      <h4>
       Learning methods and activities
      </h4>
      <p>
       Lectures, invited lectures and laboratory exercises. An individual practical involvement of every course participant is mandatory. Approximately one month before the start of the summer course, every participant will become an early adopter of a new virtual crypto currency especially developed for the course. During the one week of the summer course there will be online quizzes to support the theoretical and practical aspects. Every participant will receive homework tasks, that will be delivered one week after the summer course. The amount of mined coins, transactions and the overall wealth at the end of the course will influence the final grade.
      </p>
      <h4>
       Grading
      </h4>
      <ul>
       <li>
        50% The amount of mined coins in comparison with all other participants
       </li>
       <li>
        25% Online quizzes
       </li>
       <li>
        25% Final report and homeworks
       </li>
      </ul>
      <h4>
       Recommended previous knowledge
      </h4>
      <p>
       Basic Cryptography and Information Security. It would be very useful for participants if they have a basic knowledge of computer networks, use of Unix-like operating systems, programming languages such as C, Python, and familiarity with basic web technologies such as Javascript, PHP and SQL.
      </p>
      <h4>
       Course materials
      </h4>
      <p>
       Recommended textbook: “Bitcoin and Cryptocurrency Technologies: A Comprehensive Introduction”, by Arvind Narayanan, Joseph Bonneau, Edward Felten, Andrew Miller, Steven Goldfeder, July 2016.
      </p>
      <p>
       Online material will be provided for all participants.
      </p>
     </details>
    </div>
   </div>

    <div class="col-md-8 content">
     <h2>
      Internship
     </h2>
     <div class="subheader">
      <p>
       Between the first and second academic year, students will complete an internship in an European industry or research institution.
      </p>
     </div>
     <h3>
      Summer internship (2-5 ECTS)
     </h3>
     <p>
      During the summer internship, SECCLO students will work in a real R&D environment or expert organization as members of a project team. The duration of the internship is at least one month and the maximum of three months. A 10-week internship that meets the programme requirements result in 5 ECTS credits, which are included into the Aalto first-year curriculum.
     </p>
     <blockquote>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #ff00ff;">
        The summer internship placements in summer 2023 included e.g. Ericsson, F-Secure, Supercell Oy, SSH Communications Security Oy, Kone, Nokia, Huawei, Vaisala, Wärtsilä, and Aalto University Department of Computer Science.
       </span>
      </p>
     </blockquote>
     <p>
      Jointly with the other SECCLO consortium universities, Aalto will supervise the process of ensuring that all students find a placement for the internship and that the internship projects and work contracts are aligned with the programme goals and schedule. The organization providing the internship placement will assign a local supervisor, who will act as the student’s mentor on developing technical and career skills.
     </p>
     <p>
      During the internship, each student will also have a named contact person from the programme’s academic staff. The students will keep an online learning diary of their internship and write a reflective report. Students whose internship is shorter than 10 weeks and who still need credits for the first year will be given a special assignment, i.e. an individual research or software engineering project, to completed.
     </p>
     <blockquote>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        “At Ericsson, I learned how to develop and deploy a cloud-native application, as well as the communication and collaboration skills to work as a team. The most important thing about the internship was being open-minded and curious about the latest technologies and trying to learn as much as possible!”
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        “The most important thing about the internship was correlating all the academic knowledge in real world applications and tackling challenges associated with software development, testing and security. It complements academic knowledge with professional experience and teaches you a lot about the work culture in the country”.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        “As a SecDevOps job at KONE, I gained a lot of knowledge in both cloud computing and security. My lead and my team were both excellent. I also took part in a couple company events, where I had the chance to network with colleagues and discover more about the company’s culture.”
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        “The most important thing about the internship was that it was a practical and hands on approach for the knowledge learned during the school year and through the courses.”
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        “I worked at F-Secure as a Cloud Developer.  The best part was to meet and work with amazing people at the company. I love the Finnish work culture and their punctuality. If you want to work with a Finnish product-based company in a diverse atmosphere, this might be just it”
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        “The most important thing about the internship, other than gaining technical skills, was that I learned how to deal with work pressure and the importance of teamwork.”
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        “The internship helped me gain a better understanding of the field while putting into action the skills obtained during the studies. It was an opportunity to work on an innovative product at a company that has a history of leading transformation in technology, while being part of a large, multicultural and diverse community.”
       </span>
      </p>
     </blockquote>
     <h3>
      Learning goals
     </h3>
     <p>
      The learning goals of the internship are the following:
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Students will gain experience of working in an R&D environment or expert organization in Europe
      </li>
      <li>
       Students will develop personal contacts in European industry and research institutions
      </li>
      <li>
       Students will become familiar with several career paths options available to them
      </li>
      <li>
       Students will learn how to apply for a job in industry, including preparing an application letter and professional CV, and taking part in an internship interview
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h3>
      Offer an internship position
     </h3>
     <p>
      SECCLO associate members, companies and research organizations are invited to offer internship positions for the students. Information on possible internship positions can be sent to
      <a href="mailto:secclo@aalto.fi">
       secclo@aalto.fi
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
     </p>

		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li:active,
		.dropdown-menu li.current-menu-item,
		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li {
			background: #efefef;
		}
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a:hover,
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li:active a:hover {
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}

		.btn.btn-primary {
			background-color:#ffffff;
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}
		.btn.btn-primary:hover {
			background-color:#f7f7f7;
		}
		footer {
			background: #00c1d5;
		}
		.nav .open a {
			background: #f7f7f7;
		}
		@media only screen and (max-width: 767px) {

			.top-nav .dropdown-menu {
				background: #efefef;
			}
			.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a {
				background:transparent;
			}
		}

		/* Product title */
		.product-title__secondary-title {
			color: #ffffff;
		}

    <div class="col-md-8 content">
     <h2>
      Second-year curriculum
     </h2>
     <div class="subheader">
      <p>
       The second-year specializations (30 ECTS) are offered by five universities. The fourth and final semester of the SECCLO programme is dedicated to the Master's thesis (30 ECTS).
      </p>
     </div>
     <p>
      During the second-year studies, each student will complete 30 ECTS of courses in one of the consortium universities choosing a specialization track:
     </p>
     <table border="1" cellpadding="1" cellspacing="1" class="aalto-responsive-table has-header">
      <thead style="background: #00c1d5;">
       <tr>
        <th scope="col">
         Institution
        </th>
        <th scope="col">
         Specialization track
        </th>
       </tr>
      </thead>
      <tbody>
       <tr>
        <td data-label="Institution">
         The Royal Institute of Technology (KTH), Sweden
        </td>
        <td data-label="Title of Degree Awarded">
         Communications Systems
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr style="background: #f2f2f2;">
        <td data-label="Institution">
         The Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU)
        </td>
        <td data-label="Title of Degree Awarded">
         Information Security
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td data-label="Institution">
         Technical University of Denmark (DTU)
        </td>
        <td data-label="Title of Degree Awarded">
         Reliable Distributed Systems
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr style="background: #f2f2f2;">
        <td data-label="Institution">
         <p align="left">
          University of Tartu, Estonia
         </p>
        </td>
        <td data-label="Title of Degree Awarded">
         Cryptography
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td data-label="Institution">
         EURECOM (co-deliverance with Institut Mines Télécom), France
        </td>
        <td data-label="Title of Degree Awarded">
         Big Data Security
        </td>
       </tr>
      </tbody>
     </table>
     <h2>
      Second-year curriculum 2024-2025
     </h2>
     <h3>
      Communications Systems specialization at KTH
     </h3>
     <p>
      The KTH specialization takes a holistic view on the Internet infrastructure together with its cloud-based services and applications, and covers the topics required for developing the next generation of global communication systems that connect the cloud services and devices. Students work in a research environment with ample experimental resources and in close contact with industry – including leading system manufacturers, service developers and providers, and advanced early adopters.
     </p>
     <p>
      The specialization includes one mandatory course and a wide range of elective courses, allowing the student to focus on different subject areas, such as network systems security, network infrastructures, or wireless networking. Many courses are problem oriented with self-directed and project-based work.
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Mandatory course (15 ECTS):
      </strong>
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.kth.se/student/kurser/kurs/IK2200?l=en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        IK2200
       </a>
       Communication Systems Design Project (15 ECTS)
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Elective courses (15 ECTS):
      </strong>
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.kth.se/student/kurser/kurs/EP2300?l=en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        EP2300
       </a>
       Management of Networks and Networked Systems (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.kth.se/student/kurser/kurs/EP2500?l=en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        EP2500
       </a>
       Networked Systems Security (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.kth.se/student/kurser/kurs/EP2510?l=en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        EP2510
       </a>
       Advanced Networked Systems Security (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.kth.se/student/kurser/kurs/EP2790?l=en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        EP2790
       </a>
       Security Analysis in Large-scale Systems (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.kth.se/student/kurser/kurs/II2300?l=en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        II2300
       </a>
       Product Realization Processes I (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.kth.se/student/kurser/kurs/II2302?l=en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        II2302
       </a>
       Sensor Based Systems (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.kth.se/student/kurser/kurs/IK2510?l=en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        IK2510
       </a>
       Wireless Networks (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
      <li>
       IK2511 Project in Wireless Networks (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.kth.se/student/kurser/kurs/IK2514?l=en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        IK2514
       </a>
       Wireless Infrastructure Deployment & Economics (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
      <li>
       IK2554 Practical Voice Over IP (VoIP) (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.kth.se/student/kurser/kurs/IS2500?l=en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        IS2500
       </a>
       RFID Systems (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h3>
      Information Security specialization at NTNU
     </h3>
     <p>
      The NTNU specialization covers research related topics in systems and communication security. The students learn about authentication, key distribution, integrity, confidentiality, anonymity and digital forensics in wireless access networks for mobile users, as well as proposed new network technologies. A course on ethical hacking covers techniques used by computer hackers and penetration testers in order to better defend against intrusions and security violations in live systems, including low-level kernel and hardware topics, techniques for web applications, exploit techniques, rootkits, and some forensic techniques.
     </p>
     <p>
      The students perform a small research project and learn the phases of research from motivation to evaluation of the results. The project prepares the students for the thesis. Everyone also chooses one elective course from a broad range of topics.
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Mandatory courses (15 ECTS):
      </strong>
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.ntnu.edu/studies/courses/TTM4137#tab=omEmnet" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        TTM4138
       </a>
       Wireless Network Security (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.ntnu.edu/studies/courses/TTM4536#tab=omEmnet" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        TTM4536
       </a>
       Advanced Ethical Hacking (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Elective courses (15 ECTS):
      </strong>
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.ntnu.edu/studies/courses/TTM4502#tab=omEmnet" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        TTM4502
       </a>
       Specialization Project (7.5 ECTS)
       <ul>
        <li>
         If the student chooses TTM4502, then he/she commits to stay at NTNU and work on a master’s thesis during the spring semester with a main supervisor from NTNU, and co-supervisor from Aalto.
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.ntnu.edu/studies/courses/TDT4252#tab=omEmnet" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        TDT4252
       </a>
       Enterprise Architecture for Enterprise Innovation (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.ntnu.edu/studies/courses/IMT4203#tab=omEmnet" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        IMT4203
       </a>
       Critical Infrastructure Security (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.ntnu.edu/studies/courses/IMT4204#tab=omEmnet" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        IMT4204
       </a>
       Intrusion Detection in Physical and Virtual Networks (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.ntnu.edu/studies/courses/IMT4217#tab=omEmnet">
        IMT4217
       </a>
       Introduction to Data Privacy (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.ntnu.edu/studies/courses/TTM4195#tab=omEmnet" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        TTM4195
       </a>
       Blockchain Technologies and Cryptocurrencies (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.ntnu.edu/studies/courses/TTM4205#tab=omEmnet">
        TTM4205
       </a>
       Secure Cryptographic Implementations (7.5 ECTS)
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h3>
      Reliable Distributed Systems specialization at DTU
     </h3>
     <p>
      The DTU specialization teaches the students to design and analyze secure and reliable computer systems including embedded, cloud and software-intensive systems and services. Students work on protecting computer systems with vital functions, from controlling critical infrastructure to providing public services over the web, against threats from vandals, criminals, industrial espionage and cyber-terrorism. They learn to design embedded and distributed cloud-based systems, and to provide essential and secure functionality under a range of competing constraints: low computational resources, high availability, reliable communication, and adequate security.
     </p>
     <p>
      The curriculum also covers proactive methods and techniques for engineering the safe and secure software-intensive services typically found in cloud-based systems. The courses provide the formal underpinnings for developing these kind of systems, together with elective courses that allow the students to explore the wider context.
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Mandatory courses (at least two):
      </strong>
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="https://kurser.dtu.dk/course/02234?menulanguage=en-gb">
        02234
       </a>
       Current Topics in System Security (5 ects)
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://kurser.dtu.dk/course/02245">
        02245
       </a>
       Program Verification (7½ ects)
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://kurser.dtu.dk/course/02242?menulanguage=en-gb">
        02242
       </a>
       Program analysis (7½ ects)
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Elective courses (remaining credits up until 30 ECTS)
      </strong>
     </p>

      <li>

       </a>

      </li>
      <li>

       </a>
       * *Available as an elective from Fall 2025 onwards

     <h3>
      Cryptography specialization at UT
     </h3>
     <p>
      The UT specialization teaches the cryptographic foundations underlying secure protocols. It provides mathematical foundations necessary for an in-depth understanding of why and how cryptographic systems protect the privacy and integrity of our data, and what are the limitations of cryptographic systems. Theoretical underpinnings in cryptography and theoretical computer science are provided that allow the students to understand how security is formalized and proven, and how to design new cryptographic protocols.
     </p>
     <p>
      The content of this specialization supports both those who wish to develop new cryptographic systems, and those who wish to use existing systems and need to understand how they work and how to use them securely. The mandatory courses provide the student with sound mathematical and cryptographic foundations while the elective courses to cover diverse areas of cryptography and theoretical computer science.
     </p>

      </li>

       <br/>

     <h3>
      Big Data Security specialization at EURECOM
     </h3>
     <p>
      The EURECOM specialization aims at providing a solid knowledge of security in cloud computing and networking combined with practical design and management skills. The students learn how to identify threats, vulnerabilities and privacy problems in networks and cloud systems including the Internet of Things. They learn to integrate security solutions to a cloud computing platform and explore methods for holding cloud stakeholders accountable for the privacy and confidentiality of data in cloud systems.
     </p>
     <p>
      The curriculum has a hands-on approach that combines laboratory work with classroom education, makes use of high-profile industry speakers to introduce the latest technologies, and includes a supervised semester-long team project on a topic of industrial relevance. One focus area is communication and organizational skills together with project planning and implementation competences. A mandatory management course fosters an entrepreneurial mindset, and the elective courses enable students to further explore data science or networking.
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Mandatory courses (25 ECTS):

      </li>
      <li>

      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.eurecom.fr/en/course/managintro-2023fall" rel="noopener" target="_blank">

       </a>

      </li>

       </a>
      </li>

      </li>

      </li>

		.top-nav .navbar-brand {
			color:#00c1d5 !important;

		}
		.top-nav .container-fluid .nav li a:hover {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu .active a,
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu .active a:hover {
			background: #efefef;
		}
		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li:active,
		.dropdown-menu li.current-menu-item,
		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li {
			background: #efefef;
		}
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a:hover,
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li:active a:hover {
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}

		.btn.btn-primary {
			background-color:#ffffff;
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}
		.btn.btn-primary:hover {
			background-color:#f7f7f7;
		}
		footer {
			background: #00c1d5;
		}
		.nav .open a {
			background: #f7f7f7;
		}
		@media only screen and (max-width: 767px) {

			.top-nav .dropdown-menu {
				background: #efefef;
			}
			.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a {
				background:transparent;
			}
		}

		/* Product title */
		.product-title__secondary-title {
			color: #ffffff;
		}

     <h2>
      Master’s thesis and other programme outcomes
     </h2>
     <div class="subheader">
     </div>
     <h3>
      News
     </h3>
     <p>
      26.3.2021
      <a href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/news/alumnus-of-secclo-programme-creating-a-bond-with-finland" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       Alumnus of SECCLO programme: ‘Creating a bond with Finland’
      </a>
     </p>
     <p>
      9.9.2020
      <a href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/news/european-commission-grants-eu4m-funding-for-secclo-masters-programme-in-security-and-cloud" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       European Commission grants €4M funding for SECCLO – Master’s Programme in Security and Cloud Computing
      </a>
     </p>
     <p>
      18.6.2020
      <a href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/news/flexibility-and-enthusiastic-teaching-make-the-secclo-programme-a-great-option" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       Flexibility and enthusiastic teaching make the SECCLO programme a great option
      </a>
      . The first graduates of the SECCLO programme share their study experiences.
     </p>
     <pre><img alt="" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-4702" data-pagespeed-url-hash="3179975138" decoding="async" height="100%" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" sizes="(max-width: 1200px) 100vw, 1200px" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/268706c5-chemgraduation_sept2019_kittynorros_17.jpg" srcset="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/268706c5-chemgraduation_sept2019_kittynorros_17.jpg 1200w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/268706c5-chemgraduation_sept2019_kittynorros_17-300x158.jpg 300w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/268706c5-chemgraduation_sept2019_kittynorros_17-768x403.jpg 768w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/268706c5-chemgraduation_sept2019_kittynorros_17-1024x538.jpg 1024w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/268706c5-chemgraduation_sept2019_kittynorros_17-700x368.jpg 700w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/268706c5-chemgraduation_sept2019_kittynorros_17-640x336.jpg 640w" width="100%"/>Photo: Aalto University/Kitty Norros</pre>
     <h3>
      Master’s thesis
     </h3>
     <p>
      The final semester of the SECCLO programme is dedicated to the Master’s thesis (30 ECTS), jointly supervised by professors from both universities the student has studied in. The thesis is usually written in a research and development project either in industry or in academia.
     </p>
     <p>
      SECCLO Master’s theses 2024 (intake 2022)
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Abinaov, Murali Amudha: Simulation framework for carbon-aware workload shifting in the cloud (
       <a href="https://aaltodoc.aalto.fi/items/490a2663-0d0b-47b2-8aac-265eeab1d2a6" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        Aaltodoc
       </a>
       )
      </li>
      <li>
       Ahmad, Zainab: Multi-Platform Attestation Verification (
       <a href="https://aaltodoc.aalto.fi/items/b79cddeb-3c78-44a9-aa47-2302fa1ad788" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        Aaltodoc
       </a>
       )
      </li>
      <li>
       Ali, Farjad: UAV location privacy in the context of Integrated Sensing And Communication (
       <a href="https://aaltodoc.aalto.fi/items/a893f7c1-9699-4e32-bafa-1240f1cbdaa3" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        Aaltodoc
       </a>
       )
      </li>
      <li>
       Amadei, Andrea: Measuring and improving the performance of a latency-sensitive Java real-time system (
