<html class="no-js" lang="">
 <head>
  <meta charset="utf-8"/>
  <meta content="IE=edge,chrome=1" http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible"/>
  <title>
  </title>
  <meta content="" name="description"/>
  <meta content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1" name="viewport"/>
  <link href="apple-touch-icon.png" rel="apple-touch-icon"/>
  <style type="text/css">
   /* HEADINGS ETC. */
		a,
		.container-fluid h1, 
		.container-fluid h2, 
		.container-fluid h3, 
		.container-fluid h4, 
		.container-fluid h5 {
			color:#ffffff !important;
		}
		a:hover,a:active {
			color:#f7f7f7;
		}
		.section-title {
			border-bottom: 2px solid #ffffff;
		}
		.subheader {
			color:#f7f7f7		}

		/* HEADER */
		.header-sub {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);   
		}
		.header-mob {
	       background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%); 
		}
		
		/* PARTNERS */
		.partners {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);			
		}
		.partners h2, 
		.partners h3, 
		.partners h4, 
		.partners h5 {
			color:#00c1d5;
			border-color:#00c1d5;
		} 
		.partners.white_bg {
			background:#fff;
		}
		.partners.white_bg h2, 
		.partners.white_bg h3, 
		.partners.white_bg h4, 
		.partners.white_bg h5 {
			color: #ffffff;
			border-color: #ffffff;
		}
		/* GRADIENT BLOCKS */
		.gradient-bg {
			background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);
			color:#fff;
		}
		.gradient-bg h1,
		.gradient-bg h2,
		.gradient-bg h3, 
		.gradient-bg h4,
		.gradient-bg h5,
		.gradient-bg a {
			color:#00c1d5;
			border-color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.gradient-bg .btn {
			color: #00c1d5;
			border: 2px solid #00c1d5;
		}

		/* HERO */
		.hero {
			background-image: url('../img/glider.jpg');
		}
		.hero-content h1, 
		.hero-content a, 
		.hero-content-mob h1 {
			color:#00c1d5 !important; 
		}
		.hero-content-mob p {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.hero-content {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.hero-content .btn, 
		.hero-content-mob .btn {
			border:2px solid #00c1d5;
			color:#00c1d5 !important;

		}
		.navbar-header a {
			color: #00c1d5; 
		}
		.hero .copyright {
			color: #f0f0f0;
		}
		.hero-content-wrapper {
			background: rgba(255,255,255,0.6);
		}
		.hero-content-mob {
			background: linear-gradient(75deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);   
		}

		/* NAV */
		.container-fluid .nav>li>a:hover, 
		.container-fluid .nav>li>a:focus,
		.container-fluid .nav li a:hover, 
		.container-fluid .nav li a:active, 
		.nav li a:focus {
			background:rgba(255,255,255,0.2);
		}
		.icon-bar {
			background: #00c1d5;
		}
		.top-nav {
			background: #f7f7f7;
		}
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a,
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a:hover,
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a:focus {
			background:rgba(255,255,255,0.2);
		}
		.top-nav .nav li a,
		.top-nav .navbar-brand {
			color:#00c1d5 !important;

		}
		.top-nav .container-fluid .nav li a:hover {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu .active a,
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu .active a:hover {
			background: #efefef;
		}
		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li:active,
		.dropdown-menu li.current-menu-item,
		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li {
			background: #efefef;
		}
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a:hover,
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li:active a:hover {
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}

		.btn.btn-primary {
			background-color:#ffffff;
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}
		.btn.btn-primary:hover {
			background-color:#f7f7f7;
		}
		footer {
			background: #00c1d5;
		}
		.nav .open a {
			background: #f7f7f7;
		}
		@media only screen and (max-width: 767px) {

			.top-nav .dropdown-menu {
				background: #efefef;
			}
			.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a {
				background:transparent;
			}
		}

		/* Product title */
		.product-title__secondary-title {
			color: #ffffff;
		}
  </style>

       <li class="page_item page-item-1585">
        <a href="https://www.secclo.eu/programme/internship/">
         Internship
        </a>
       </li>
       <li class="page_item page-item-85">
        <a href="https://www.secclo.eu/programme/second-year-curriculum/">
         Second-year curriculum
        </a>
       </li>
       <li class="page_item page-item-4096">
        <a href="https://www.secclo.eu/programme/masters-thesis-and-other-programme-outcomes/">
         Master’s thesis and other programme outcomes
        </a>
       </li>
       <li class="page_item page-item-91 current_page_item">
        <a aria-current="page" href="https://www.secclo.eu/programme/careers-and-employability/">
         Careers and employability
        </a>
       </li>
       <li class="page_item page-item-6250">
        <a href="https://www.secclo.eu/programme/alumni-event-16-june-copenhagen/">
         Alumni event on 16 June, Copenhagen
        </a>
       </li>
      </ul>
     </img>
    </div>
    <div class="col-md-8 content">
     <h2>
      Careers and employability
     </h2>
     <div class="subheader">
      <p>
       There is a shortage of professionals in Europe and worldwide who are able to develop products and services for the modern cloud and mobile computing platforms and to do this in a secure way.
      </p>
     </div>
     <p>
      SECCLO responds to the demand for graduate engineers who are able to innovate and implement the next-generation cloud and distributed computing services and applications. There is also an urgent need for skilled system-security experts who are able to analyse and solve technical challenges in information security and privacy in distributed and cloud-based systems.
     </p>
     <p>
      SECCLO links security studies tightly with product and service development skills. Our graduates will be able to understand the latest security technologies and research, continuously update their knowledge, and apply it to the development of new cloud and distributed computing solutions. The
      <strong>
       dual perspective of security plus R&D skills for the cloud environment gives the graduates multiple options for their future career
      </strong>
      in the European labour market. The graduates are well prepared for
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       international industrial R&D jobs
      </li>
      <li>
       security engineering and consulting
      </li>
      <li>
       various expert roles
      </li>
      <li>
       doctoral studies at the partner universities and internationally.
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      The career prospects of SECCLO graduates are very good.
     </p>
     <p>
      <img alt="" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-3130" data-pagespeed-url-hash="2484092523" decoding="async" height="100%" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" sizes="(max-width: 1200px) 100vw, 1200px" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/10/cb244d48-img_0746.jpg" srcset="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/10/cb244d48-img_0746.jpg 1200w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/10/cb244d48-img_0746-300x200.jpg 300w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/10/cb244d48-img_0746-768x513.jpg 768w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/10/cb244d48-img_0746-1024x684.jpg 1024w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/10/cb244d48-img_0746-700x467.jpg 700w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/10/cb244d48-img_0746-640x427.jpg 640w" width="100%"/>
     </p>
     <h3>
      First SECCLO graduates
     </h3>
     <p>
      The first SECCLO students graduated in summer/autumn 2020.
     </p>
     <p>
      Typical
      <strong>
       job titles
      </strong>
      of graduates include, e.g.:
     </p>
     <p>
      <em>
       Security Consultant, Cyber Security Specialist, DevOps Engineer, Lead Software Engineer, Security Engineer, Experienced Developer, Infrastructure Engineer, Digital Identity Specialist, Security Consultant, Systems Software Engineer,
      </em>
      <i>
       Chief Technology Officer
      </i>
      <em>
       ..
      </em>
     </p>
     <p>
      Examples of
      <strong>
       companies
      </strong>
      where SECCLO alumni work or have been employed include, e.g.:
     </p>
     <p>
      <i>
       Ericsson
      </i>
      <i>
       , Kone, Nokia,
      </i>
      <i>
       WithSecure
      </i>
      <i>
       ,
      </i>
      <i>
       SAP, Meta, Samsung,
      </i>
      <i>
       Nordnet, Robert Bosch GmbH..
      </i>
     </p>
     <h3>
      Proven success of our predecessor
     </h3>
     <p>
      According to the statistics on SECCLO’s predecessor,
      <em>
       NordSecMob – Master’s Programme in Security and Mobile Computing
      </em>
      , which had its student intakes 2006-2016:
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Out of over 200 NordSecMob alumni,
       <strong>
        95%
       </strong>
       had a job within 6 months after graduation.
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      Typical
      <strong>
       job titles
      </strong>
      of NordSecMob alumni are, e.g.:
     </p>
     <p>
      <em>
       Software Engineer, Security Analyst, Development Engineer, Software & Systems Reliability Engineer, IT Security Specialist, R&D Engineer, Wireless Engineer, Enterprise Data Architect, Security Architect, Data Scientist, Web Developer, Security Engineer, Mobile Developer, Research Assistant, Doctoral Student,…
      </em>
     </p>
     <p>
      Examples of
      <strong>
       companies
      </strong>
      where NordSecMob alumni work or have been employed include, e.g.:
     </p>
     <p>
      <em>
       Ericsson, Microsoft, Nokia, Google, F-Secure Corporation, Facebook, Amazon, Accenture, Nordea Bank, Skype, Siemens, Telia Company, Alibaba Group, IBM Research, Danske Babk, FireEye, Inc., EY,…
      </em>
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Universities
      </strong>
      where NordSecMob alumni are doing or have done their doctoral studies include (in addition to consortium universities), e.g.:
     </p>
     <p>
      <em>
       Imperial College London, University of Oxford, UC Irvine, Saarland University, TU Eindhoven, Northern Kentucky University, University of Waterloo, ETH Zurich, TU Darmstadt, University of Glasgow, TU Berlin, University of South Australia, EPFL, Ku Leuven, University of Geneva, University of Alabama at Birmingham, …
      </em>
     </p>
    </div>
   </div>

    <div class="col-md-8 content">
     <h2>
      Admission
     </h2>
     <div class="subheader">
     </div>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #ff00ff;">
       <strong>
        There will be no student intake in 2025
       </strong>
       .
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #ff00ff;">
       SECCLO will not open admission for autumn 2025 student intake. The last application round funded with Erasmus Mundus scholarships by the European Commission was autumn 2024 student intake and the consortium is focusing on further development of the programme during 2024-2025 so there is no intake for 2025. We will have more information on the possible new programme by the end of August 2025 and the next possible application period, for autumn 2026 student intake, will open in autumn 2025. Stay tuned for further information!
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #ff00ff;">
       Please leave your contact information
       <a href="https://link.webropolsurveys.com/S/480CFAF2694BD8B0" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        by clicking the link here if you are interested in receiving further information on SECCLO’s successor.
       </a>
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #ff00ff;">
       For other Master’s programmes available in similar subjects, please visit the websites of our consortium universities (links
       <a href="https://www.secclo.eu/about/consortium-and-industry-partners/">
        here
       </a>
       ).
       <br/>
      </span>
     </p>
     <h3>
     </h3>
     <h3>
      <span style="color: #999999;">
       Application round for autumn 2024 student intake
      </span>
     </h3>
     <table border="1" cellpadding="1" cellspacing="1">
      <thead style="background: #00c1d5;">
       <tr>
        <td>
         <span style="color: #ffffff;">
          <strong>
           Selection schedule
           <br/>
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: center;">
         <span style="color: #ffffff;">
          <strong>
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
       </tr>
      </thead>
      <tbody>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <span style="color: #999999;">
          <strong>
           22 November 2023 at 9 am (GMT +2)
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: left;">
         <span style="color: #999999;">
          Application period begins, online application form opens.
         </span>
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <span style="color: #999999;">
          <strong>
           4 January 2024 at 3 pm (GMT +2)
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: left;">
         <span style="color: #999999;">
          Application deadline, online application form closes.
          <br/>
         </span>
         <span style="color: #999999;">
          Deadline for submitting the online application form with all requested application documents.
         </span>
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <span style="color: #999999;">
          18 January 2024
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: left;">
         <span style="color: #999999;">
          Final deadline for the English language test result to be received by SECCLO Admissions Office.
         </span>
         <p>
          <span style="color: #999999;">
           Final deadline for the referee request submissions/recommendation letters.
          </span>
         </p>
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <span style="color: #999999;">
          January-February 2024
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: left;">
         <span style="color: #999999;">
          Academic evaluation of eligible SECCLO applications.
         </span>
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <span style="color: #999999;">
          February-March 2024
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: left;">
         <span style="color: #999999;">
          Selection results are published.
         </span>
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <span style="color: #999999;">
          31 July 2024
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: left;">
         <span style="color: #999999;">
          <em>
           Selected students only
          </em>
          : Deadline to graduate for applicants who applied with an incomplete degree.
          <br/>
         </span>
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <span style="color: #999999;">
          8 August 2024
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: left;">
         <span style="color: #999999;">
          <em>
           Selected students only
          </em>
          : Deadline for the certified copies of the degree certificate and transcript of records to be mailed to Aalto University.
          <br/>
         </span>
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <span style="color: #999999;">
          Late August/early September 2024
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: left;">
         <span style="color: #999999;">
          SECCLO first-year studies at Aalto University begin with the Orientation Week.
         </span>
        </td>
       </tr>
      </tbody>
     </table>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #999999;">
       For further details on the application process and deadlines, see
       <a href="https://www.secclo.eu/admission/how-to-apply/" style="color: #999999;">
        How to apply
       </a>
       .
      </span>
     </p>
    </div>
   </div>

			color:#f7f7f7		}

		/* HEADER */
		.header-sub {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);   
		}
		.header-mob {
	       background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%); 
		}
		
		/* PARTNERS */
		.partners {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);			
		}
		.partners h2, 
		.partners h3, 
		.partners h4, 
		.partners h5 {
			color:#00c1d5;
			border-color:#00c1d5;
		} 
		.partners.white_bg {
			background:#fff;
		}
		.partners.white_bg h2, 
		.partners.white_bg h3, 
		.partners.white_bg h4, 
		.partners.white_bg h5 {
			color: #ffffff;
			border-color: #ffffff;
		}
		/* GRADIENT BLOCKS */
		.gradient-bg {
			background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);
			color:#fff;
		}
		.gradient-bg h1,
		.gradient-bg h2,
		.gradient-bg h3, 
		.gradient-bg h4,
		.gradient-bg h5,
		.gradient-bg a {
			color:#00c1d5;
			border-color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.gradient-bg .btn {
			color: #00c1d5;
			border: 2px solid #00c1d5;
		}

		/* HERO */
		.hero {
			background-image: url('../img/glider.jpg');
		}
		.hero-content h1, 
		.hero-content a, 
		.hero-content-mob h1 {
			color:#00c1d5 !important; 
		}
		.hero-content-mob p {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.hero-content {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.hero-content .btn, 
		.hero-content-mob .btn {
			border:2px solid #00c1d5;
			color:#00c1d5 !important;

		}
		.navbar-header a {
			color: #00c1d5; 
		}
		.hero .copyright {
			color: #f0f0f0;
		}
		.hero-content-wrapper {
			background: rgba(255,255,255,0.6);
		}
		.hero-content-mob {
			background: linear-gradient(75deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);   
		}

		/* NAV */
		.container-fluid .nav>li>a:hover, 
		.container-fluid .nav>li>a:focus,
		.container-fluid .nav li a:hover, 
		.container-fluid .nav li a:active, 
		.nav li a:focus {
			background:rgba(255,255,255,0.2);
		}
		.icon-bar {
			background: #00c1d5;
		}
		.top-nav {
			background: #f7f7f7;
		}
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a,
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a:hover,
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a:focus {
			background:rgba(255,255,255,0.2);
		}
		.top-nav .nav li a,
		.top-nav .navbar-brand {
			color:#00c1d5 !important;

		}
		.top-nav .container-fluid .nav li a:hover {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu .active a,
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu .active a:hover {
			background: #efefef;
		}
		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li:active,
		.dropdown-menu li.current-menu-item,
		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li {
			background: #efefef;
		}
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a:hover,
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li:active a:hover {
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}

		.btn.btn-primary {
			background-color:#ffffff;
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}
		.btn.btn-primary:hover {
			background-color:#f7f7f7;
		}
		footer {
			background: #00c1d5;
		}
		.nav .open a {
			background: #f7f7f7;
		}
		@media only screen and (max-width: 767px) {

			.top-nav .dropdown-menu {
				background: #efefef;
			}
			.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a {
				background:transparent;
			}
		}

		/* Product title */
		.product-title__secondary-title {
			color: #ffffff;
		}
  </style>

     <h2>
      Admission requirements
     </h2>
     <div class="subheader">
     </div>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #ff00ff;">
       The information below applies to 2024 application round which ended on 4 January 2024. There will be no student intake in 2025. Please see
       <a href="https://www.secclo.eu/admission/admission/">
        here
       </a>
       for further information.
       <br/>
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       To be admitted to SECCLO, you will first need to fulfil our
       <strong>
        general eligibility requirements
       </strong>
       . If your application is eligible, it proceeds to the academic evaluation. The evaluation of eligible applications and the allocation of scholarships is made based on SECCLO’s
       <strong>
        student selection criteria
       </strong>
       .
       <br/>
      </span>
     </p>
     <h3>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       General eligibility requirements
      </span>
     </h3>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       To be considered eligible for SECCLO, you will need to fulfil these four general eligibility requirements:
      </span>
     </p>
     <ol>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Your previous
        <strong>
         higher education institution
        </strong>
        needs to be officially recognized.
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Your previous
        <strong>
         degree
        </strong>
        needs to meet our requirements.
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        If an
        <strong>
         English
        </strong>
        <strong>
         language test result
        </strong>
        is required from you, your test scores will need to fulfil our minimum requirements and you will need to submit the test result as instructed before the given deadline.
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        You will need to submit your online application and all compulsory
        <a href="https://www.secclo.eu/admission/application-documents/" style="color: #808080;">
         <strong>
          application documents
         </strong>
        </a>
        as instructed before the application deadline.
       </span>
      </li>
     </ol>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       Please see further information below.
      </span>
     </p>
     <h4>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       Requirements for previous higher education institution and degree
      </span>
     </h4>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       Applicants should hold a Bachelor degree* awarded by a university or a higher education institution.
      </span>
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        The awarding institution has to be
        <strong>
         a recognized part of the official national education system of the country
        </strong>
        , i.e., to be listed as a degree-granting higher education institution by the country where it is located or by a relevant international organization such as UNESCO.
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        The scope of a relevant degree awarded by a higher education institution must be equivalent to
        <strong>
         180 ECTS credits or at least three years of full-time study
        </strong>
        . The degree must give eligibility for Master’s degree studies in the awarding country.
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       The SECCLO Consortium reserves the right to determine whether the higher education institution or the degree fulfils the requirements.
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       *) Applicants in their final year of studies are eligible to apply provided that they will graduate by 31 July 2024. If the applicant is not able to graduate on time or fails to deliver a degree certificate by the given deadline, their conditional acceptance to the programme will be cancelled.
      </span>
     </p>
     <h4>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       Requirements for English language proficiency
      </span>
     </h4>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       Our language of instruction is English, and the applicants are expected to have an excellent command of it. The accepted language tests and their minimum score requirements are listed below.
      </span>
     </p>
     <table border="1" cellpadding="1" cellspacing="1">
      <thead style="background: #00c1d5;">
       <tr>
        <td>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: center;">
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          <strong>
           Minimum total score
           <br/>
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: center;">
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          <strong>
           Minimum writing score
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
       </tr>
      </thead>
      <tbody>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          <strong>
           IELTS
          </strong>
          (Academic)*
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: center;">
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          <strong>
           6.5
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: center;">
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          <strong>
           6.0
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          <strong>
           TOEFL iBT
          </strong>
          (Internet-based Test)*
          <strong>
           <br/>
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: center;">
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          <strong>
           92
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: center;">
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          <strong>
           22
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          <strong>
           C1 Advanced
          </strong>
          (former Cambridge Certificate of Advanced English, CAE)
          <strong>
           <br/>
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: center;">
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          <strong>
           A, B,
          </strong>
          or
          <strong>
           C
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: center;">
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          –
         </span>
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          <strong>
           C2 Proficiency
          </strong>
          (former Cambridge Certificate of Proficiency in English, CPE)
          <strong>
           <br/>
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: center;">
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          <strong>
           A, B, C
          </strong>
          or
          <strong>
           C1
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: center;">
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          –
         </span>
        </td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
        <td>
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          <strong>
           Pearson Test of English
          </strong>
          (PTE Academic)
          <strong>
           <br/>
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: center;">
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          <strong>
           62
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
        <td style="text-align: center;">
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          <strong>
           54
          </strong>
         </span>
        </td>
       </tr>
      </tbody>
     </table>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       *) Also
       <em>
        IELTS Online (Academic), IELTS Indicator (Academic)
       </em>
       and
       <em>
        TOEFL iBT® Home Edition
       </em>
       are accepted in the 2024 admission.
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       The minimum requirements are very strict. If your scores do not fulfil the minimum score requirements, your application will not be processed further. You cannot combine scores from different test dates (e.g.
       <em>
        TOEFL MyBest scores
       </em>
       is not accepted).
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       IELTS, TOEFL and PTE results are valid for two years starting from the test date. Thus, test results from the tests taken on or after
       <strong>
        22 November 2021
       </strong>
       are acceptable in the 2024 application round.
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       <strong>
        Only the language tests listed above are accepted
       </strong>
       . For further information on language test result deadline and submitting your test scores for verification, see
       <a href="https://secclo.eu/admission/how-to-apply/" style="color: #808080;">
        How to apply
       </a>
       ->
       <em>
        Step 4
       </em>
       .
      </span>
     </p>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Exemptions from the English language test requirement (click to open)
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        The language test requirement is waived for the following groups:
       </span>
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <span style="color: #808080;">
         Applicants whose higher education degree has been taken at an English-medium programme requiring physical on-site presence at a university in
         <strong>
          Australia, Canada, New Zealand, Singapore, South Africa, the United Kingdom, the United States, an EU/EEA country
         </strong>
         , or
         <strong>
          Switzerland
         </strong>
         .
        </span>
        <ul>
         <li>
          <span style="color: #808080;">
           If the degree is completed in an EU/EEA country (except Ireland), Switzerland, Canada or South Africa, the language of the degree must be stated unambiguously in the degree certificate or its appendix, or in the transcript of records or other official document issued by the awarding higher education institution.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li>
          <span style="color: #808080;">
           A minimum of one half of the degree must be completed in a country and higher education institution that meets the requirements for exempting the applicant from taking an English test.
          </span>
         </li>
        </ul>
       </li>
       <li>
        <span style="color: #808080;">
         Degree students from SECCLO consortium universities (Aalto, KTH, NTNU, DTU, University of Tartu, EURECOM).
        </span>
        <ul>
         <li>
          <span style="color: #808080;">
           A minimum of one half of the degree must be completed at a consortium university.
          </span>
         </li>
        </ul>
       </li>
       <li>
        <span style="color: #808080;">
         Applicants, who have attended SECCLO consortium universities (Aalto, KTH, NTNU, DTU, University of Tartu, EURECOM) as exchange students.
        </span>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         All other applicants are expected to present a valid English language test result without exceptions.
         <br/>
        </strong>
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <p>
     </p>
     <h3>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       Student selection criteria
      </span>
     </h3>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       Admission to the SECCLO programme is granted on a competitive basis, and the applicants are assessed based on their previous academic record. The selection is document based. The final evaluation of the eligible applications and the ranking of qualified students is made based on the following criteria:
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       <strong>
        1. Relevance of previous studies
        <br/>
       </strong>
       Successful applicants are expected to have a
       <strong>
        high-quality Bachelor’s degree in computer science or information technology or mathematics. Excellent candidates with degrees in other fields will be considered if they have sufficient studies in the required subject areas
       </strong>
       (see below).
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       Required background consists of sufficient studies in:
      </span>
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         mathematics (linear algebra, calculus, probability theory, statistics, and discrete mathematics)
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         programming skills
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         algorithms and data structures
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         databases
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         theory of computation
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         computer networks
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         web software and online services
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         software engineering
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       Knowledge of one or more of the following areas is considered an advantage:
      </span>
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         additional knowledge of mathematical methods
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         cryptography and its mathematical foundations
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         mobile applications
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         operating systems
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         distributed computing
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         cloud computing and big data
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         embedded systems
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         advanced computer networking
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         machine learning and data mining
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         information security
        </em>
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       The contents of the applicant’s previous degree(s) are evaluated based on the courses on the official transcript of records. Relevant work experience, professional certificates and online courses can also be taken into account in the evaluation, but they do not in general compensate for the absence of university-level studies covering the theoretical foundations of the required subjects.
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       <strong>
        2. Academic performance
       </strong>
      </span>
      <br/>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       The applicant’s academic performance will be evaluated based on the grade point average (GPA) and grades in key courses. The time spent on the previous studies will also be considered.
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       <strong>
        The programme is looking for applicants with excellent academic performance in their previous studies
       </strong>
       . This means that the applicant has achieved consistently excellent grades throughout the degree studies (very high weighted average grade or GPA).
      </span>
     </p>
     <blockquote>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        During the evaluation process, we assess relevance of previous studies and academic performance first. Only applications that meet the requirements for these two criteria will be evaluated further.
        <br/>
       </span>
      </p>
     </blockquote>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       <strong>
        3. Recognition and quality of institution
        <br/>
       </strong>
       We expect applicants to have completed their previous degree in a high-quality university and programme. The recognition of the applicant’s home university also affects the interpretation of the grades when evaluating the academic performance.
       <strong>
        <br/>
       </strong>
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       <strong>
        4. Motivation and commitment to SECCLO studies
        <br/>
       </strong>
       The applicant should tell us about their expectations for the SECCLO programme, career aspirations, relevant experience, and achievements. They should be motivated to study in any of the programme universities and be committed to full‐time studies with a plan to complete the Master’s degree in two years. We are looking for applicants who are able to express clearly their reasons for applying to SECCLO and describe why they would be excellent candidates for the programme.
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       Studies in the SECCLO programme should provide genuinely new knowledge for the applicant. If the applicant already has a Master’s degree, the motivation letter should clearly indicate why another Master’s degree is necessary.
       <strong>
        <br/>
       </strong>
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       <strong>
        5. Other relevant achievements
        <br/>
       </strong>
       Beyond their academic record, applicants may have other experience, knowledge and qualifications that prepare them for the Master’s studies and distinguish them among their peers. We particularly value relevant work experience in the area of the programme, participation in scientific research leading to publications, entrepreneurship, and special achievements such as success in competitions.
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       <strong>
        6.
       </strong>
       <strong>
        English language proficiency
        <br/>
       </strong>
       A good English language test result adds value to the application.
       <strong>
        <br/>
       </strong>
      </span>
     </p>
     <blockquote>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        All six SECCLO consortium universities participate in the evaluation of applications and in the joint selection meeting. The allocation of scholarships is based on the same criteria as the student selection decisions and the best selected students will be offered scholarships. The scholarship decisions are given together with the selection decisions.
       </span>
      </p>
     </blockquote>
    </div>
   </div>

		.partners.white_bg h3, 
		.partners.white_bg h4, 
		.partners.white_bg h5 {
			color: #ffffff;
			border-color: #ffffff;
		}
		/* GRADIENT BLOCKS */
		.gradient-bg {
			background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);
			color:#fff;
		}
		.gradient-bg h1,
		.gradient-bg h2,
		.gradient-bg h3, 
		.gradient-bg h4,
		.gradient-bg h5,
		.gradient-bg a {
			color:#00c1d5;
			border-color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.gradient-bg .btn {
			color: #00c1d5;
			border: 2px solid #00c1d5;
		}

		/* HERO */
		.hero {
			background-image: url('../img/glider.jpg');
		}
		.hero-content h1, 
		.hero-content a, 
		.hero-content-mob h1 {
			color:#00c1d5 !important; 
		}
		.hero-content-mob p {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.hero-content {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.hero-content .btn, 
		.hero-content-mob .btn {
			border:2px solid #00c1d5;
			color:#00c1d5 !important;

		}
		.navbar-header a {
			color: #00c1d5; 
		}
		.hero .copyright {
			color: #f0f0f0;
		}
		.hero-content-wrapper {
			background: rgba(255,255,255,0.6);
		}
		.hero-content-mob {
			background: linear-gradient(75deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);   
		}

		/* NAV */
		.container-fluid .nav>li>a:hover, 
		.container-fluid .nav>li>a:focus,
		.container-fluid .nav li a:hover, 
		.container-fluid .nav li a:active, 
		.nav li a:focus {
			background:rgba(255,255,255,0.2);
		}
		.icon-bar {
			background: #00c1d5;
		}
		.top-nav {
			background: #f7f7f7;
		}
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a,
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a:hover,
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a:focus {
			background:rgba(255,255,255,0.2);
		}
		.top-nav .nav li a,
		.top-nav .navbar-brand {
			color:#00c1d5 !important;

		}
		.top-nav .container-fluid .nav li a:hover {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu .active a,
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu .active a:hover {
			background: #efefef;
		}
		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li:active,
		.dropdown-menu li.current-menu-item,
		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li {
			background: #efefef;
		}
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a:hover,
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li:active a:hover {
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}

		.btn.btn-primary {
			background-color:#ffffff;
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}
		.btn.btn-primary:hover {
			background-color:#f7f7f7;
		}
		footer {
			background: #00c1d5;
		}
		.nav .open a {
			background: #f7f7f7;
		}
		@media only screen and (max-width: 767px) {

			.top-nav .dropdown-menu {
				background: #efefef;
			}
			.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a {
				background:transparent;
			}
		}

		/* Product title */
		.product-title__secondary-title {
			color: #ffffff;
		}
  </style>

     <h2>
      Application documents
     </h2>
     <div class="subheader">
     </div>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #ff00ff;">
       The information below applies to 2024 application round which ended on 4 January 2024. There will be no student intake in 2025. Please see
       <a href="https://www.secclo.eu/admission/admission/">
        here
       </a>
       for further information.
       <br/>
      </span>
     </p>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       SECCLO’s application process is conducted fully online. The application documents must be uploaded to the online application portal before the application deadline, 4 January 2024 at 3 pm (GMT +2).
      </span>
     </p>
     <blockquote>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <em>
         After the admissions results are published, the selected SECCLO students must submit certified (attested) copies of the Bachelor’s degree certificate and transcript of records, fulfilling the country-specific requirements below, by the given deadline. Admission is conditional until certified hard copies of the documents have been received. The conditionally granted study right will be cancelled if the certified documents are not received as requested. The certified documents will be compared to the documents uploaded to the application portal. During the admission phase, SECCLO Admissions Office will perform spot checks on educational documents with the issuing universities
        </em>
        .
       </span>
      </p>
     </blockquote>
     <h4>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       Compulsory application documents
      </span>
     </h4>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Scanned colour copy of the original
        <strong>
         Bachelor degree certificate/diploma
        </strong>
        or a certificate of equivalent studies (if graduated)
       </span>
       <ul>
        <li>
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          Authorized translation of the degree certificate/diploma into English, if applicable
         </span>
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Scanned colour copy of the original
        <strong>
         official transcript of records
        </strong>
       </span>
       <ul>
        <li>
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          Authorized translation of the transcript of records into English, if applicable
         </span>
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Motivation letter
        </strong>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Curriculum Vitae
        </strong>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Copy of
        <strong>
         a valid passport
        </strong>
        or an official government-issued identification card with photo, including information on citizenship
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Proof of
        <strong>
         place of residency
        </strong>
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Proof of
        <strong>
         English language proficiency
        </strong>
       </span>
       <ul>
        <li>
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          For the accepted language tests and exemptions to this requirement, see
          <a href="https://secclo.eu/admission/admission-requirements/" style="color: #808080;">
           Admission requirements
          </a>
          .
         </span>
        </li>
        <li>
         <span style="color: #808080;">
          For information on how to submit your language test scores for verification, see
          <a href="https://secclo.eu/admission/how-to-apply/" style="color: #808080;">
           How to apply
          </a>
          -> Step 4.
         </span>
        </li>
       </ul>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h4>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       <strong>
        Additional application documents requested
       </strong>
      </span>
     </h4>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Two academic recommendation letters
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Course descriptions of relevant courses taken
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Scanned colour copies of possible other higher education degrees or studies (if taken), and their transcripts of records with authorized translations (if applicable). E.g. Master’s degree studies, exchange studies, additional non-degree studies.
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Copies of relevant work certificates, publications, or other relevant activities (if available)
       </span>
      </li>
      <li>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        GMAT/GRE test result (if available)
       </span>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       For further information on the above documents, see below (click to open) and our
       <a href="https://secclo.eu/admission/faq/" style="color: #808080;">
        FAQ
       </a>
       .
      </span>
     </p>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Degree certificate and provisional degree certificate
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        The
        <strong>
         degree certificate
        </strong>
        must include the name of the degree, the name of the institution awarding the degree, the date of awarding the degree, and the name of the student.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Provisional degree certificate
        </strong>
        can also be accepted. In some countries, there can be a delay before the final degree certificate is issued to graduates. In such cases, a provisional (or temporary) degree certificate can be issued to a student who has successfully completed all the studies included in the degree and has graduated. The provisional degree certificate must include the name of the degree, the name of the institution awarding the degree, the date of awarding the degree, and the name of the student. A statement of completion of the studies is not sufficient.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        We recommend that applicants applying with an
        <strong>
         incomplete Bachelor’s degree
        </strong>
        (i.e. final year students) submit a statement by their home university confirming their student status, name of the degree in both the original language and in English, and their expected graduation date.
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Official transcript of records
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        The transcript of records must be an official transcript bearing the stamp of the educational institution. The transcript of records must include the individual courses taken, their grades and the credits awarded.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        If your degree contains studies completed in some other higher education institution (e.g. transfer studies, top-up degrees), the required information must be submitted also of those studies. Please submit all transcripts of records from the duration of your higher education studies.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Applicants applying with an
        <strong>
         incomplete Bachelor’s degree
        </strong>
        (i.e. final year students) can submit a a list of courses to be completed during the final semester and/or a short description of your thesis/final project work. Please note, however, that these courses do not have quite the same value as completed courses.
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Authorized translation
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        All application documents must be made available in English. If the original documents are not issued in English, the applicant must provide official, word-for-word translations of them. The translation is official if it has been done by the
        <strong>
         higher education institution that awarded the degree
        </strong>
        or
        <strong>
         by a certified translator (authorized translator)
        </strong>
        . The translations must have the certified translator’s stamp and signature.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        A
        <strong>
         Diploma Supplement
        </strong>
        issued in English can be accepted as a translation of a degree certificate, if it contains all the same information as the degree certificate (at least the name of the degree, the name of the institution awarding the degree, the date of awarding the degree, and the name of the student).
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Motivation letter
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Motivation letter is part of the online application form. In it, you are asked to “
        <em>
         Tell us about your expectations for the SECCLO programme, career aspirations, relevant experience and achievements
        </em>
        “. The maximum word limit is 500 words.
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Curriculum Vitae
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Your Curriculum Vitae (CV) should showcase you as a potential SECCLO applicant and provide a summary of your education, work experience, and relevant skills and achievements so far. We would prefer for you to use
        <a href="http://europass.cedefop.europa.eu/documents/curriculum-vitae" rel="noopener noreferrer" style="color: #808080;" target="_blank">
         Europass CV format
        </a>
        , but accept other formats as well.
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Proof of place of residency
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        A proof of place of residence (PPR) is a document verifying the country and the city you currently live in. The document must:
       </span>
      </p>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <span style="color: #808080;">
         be issued within 12 months from the SECCLO application deadline i.e.
         <strong>
          dated on or after 4 January 2023
         </strong>
         ,
        </span>
       </li>
       <li>
        <span style="color: #808080;">
         have
         <strong>
          your name
         </strong>
         on it and clearly (in print, in Latin alphabet) state your
         <strong>
          current country and city of residence
         </strong>
         , ideally also your full address, and
        </span>
       </li>
       <li>
        <span style="color: #808080;">
         be available
         <strong>
          in English
         </strong>
         /
         <strong>
          translated into English
         </strong>
         by a certified translator (authorized translator).
        </span>
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        SECCLO’s own
        <a href="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2022/11/bf2278bc-secclo_ppr.pdf" style="color: #808080;">
         PPR template
        </a>
        (.pdf) is recommended and acceptable if it is signed by university administration (e.g. student services) or workplace HR. Please see
        <a href="https://www.secclo.eu/admission/faq/" style="color: #808080;">
         FAQ
        </a>
        ->
        <em>
         Application documents
        </em>
        for information on other acceptable documents.
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Recommendation letters
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        You will have two options for submitting the recommendation letters:
       </span>
      </p>
      <ol>
       <li>
        <span style="color: #808080;">
         Send a
         <strong>
          referee request
         </strong>
         from the application portal to your referee using References tab (preferred). Upon receiving the request, the referee will fill in an online form or upload a recommendation letter for your SECCLO application. You can see that a recommendation has been submitted, but not its contents. The referee will need to submit the recommendation within two weeks from the SECCLO application deadline at the latest i.e. by 18 January 2024.
        </span>
       </li>
       <li>
        <span style="color: #808080;">
         If you already possess the letter(s) you want to use for your SECCLO application, you can upload them to the application portal yourself. The field for this can be found from the Upload tab -> “
         <em>
          Recommendation letters
         </em>
         “. NB! In this case, there is no need to send a referee request.
        </span>
       </li>
      </ol>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        It is also possible to combine different options, that is, you can upload one recommendation letter yourself and ask for the referee to submit another.
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Course descriptions
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Course descriptions are part of the online application form. You will be asked to submit short course descriptions in order to provide further information on the courses taken in relevant subjects. You can add course descriptions in up to five courses in each of the required background subjects and up to two courses in each of the additional knowledge subjects (see
        <a href="https://secclo.production.geniem.io/admission1/admission-requirements/" style="color: #808080;">
         Admission requirements
        </a>
        ->
        <em>
         Student selection criteria -> Relevance of previous studies
        </em>
        ).
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        If the course descriptions are not available in English, you can translate them yourself. If the course descriptions or the learning outcomes of the course are very long, you can summarize them. A list of most important topics covered will suffice. Course descriptions are not obligatory, but add value for your application. They do not need to be verified by your university.
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <p>
     </p>
     <h4>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       <em>
        Admitted students only:
       </em>
       Certified (attested) copies of educational documents to be submitted after admissions results
       <br/>
      </span>
     </h4>
     <p>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       After the admissions results are published in February-March 2024, the applicants selected to SECCLO must submit certified (attested) hard copies of their Bachelor’s degree certificate and transcript of records
       <strong>
        by 8 August 2024
       </strong>
       . For certain countries, we have additional country-specific requirements (see below). Please note that these requirements apply
       <strong>
        only to applicants admitted to SECCLO
       </strong>
       .
      </span>
     </p>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Official attestation of copies (click to open)
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Copies of study certificates (Bachelor’s degree certificate and transcripts of records) must be certified to be true copies of the original documents by the
        <strong>
         issuing university or a notary public
        </strong>
        . Each page must have the certifying official’s original signature, printed name, ink stamp and date. Copies of officially certified copies are not accepted, the
        <strong>
        </strong>
        certifying official’s ink stamps and signatures must be original. A multiple-page certified copy must be certified on the front side of every page.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        The certified paper (hard) copies must be delivered to
        <a href="https://secclo.eu/about/contact/" style="color: #808080;">
         SECCLO Admissions Office
        </a>
        either by mail, courier service or delivered in person.
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <p>
     </p>
     <h5>
      <span style="color: #808080;">
       Country-specific document requirements (click on the country to open)
      </span>
     </h5>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Australia and New Zealand
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Degree certificate
        </strong>
        :
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        A
        <strong>
         certified copy of degree certificate
        </strong>
        is required. A certified copy of Australian Higher Education Graduation Statement (AHEGS) is accepted as well.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Transcript of records
        </strong>
        : If your university uses My eQuals service, share your electronic transcript via
        <a href="https://www.myequals.edu.au/" rel="noopener" style="color: #808080;" target="_blank">
         My eQuals
        </a>
        to
        <a class="mgd_spmspn" href="mailto:secclo@aalto.fi" style="color: #808080;">
         secclo@aalto.fi
        </a>
        .
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        If it does not, an official transcript of records must be sent directly from your university to the SECCLO Admissions Office in a sealed envelope by post. Transcripts handled or delivered by the applicant will not be accepted. The transcript of records must be certified with an original stamp of the university and an original signature of the certifying officer. Regular photocopies are not accepted. The envelope must be sealed by the awarding institution’s official stamp across the back flap. In addition to the transcript, the envelope can contain only official documents awarded by the university (e.g. degree certificate or diploma supplement).
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Cameroon, Eritrea, Ethiopia, Ghana, Indonesia, Kenya, Malaysia, Nigeria, South Africa, Sudan
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Degree certificate
        </strong>
        : The copy of the degree certificate must be stamped and signed by the issuing institution or a notary public. Please see above for further information (
        <em>
         Official attestation of copies
        </em>
        ).
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Transcript of records
        </strong>
        : If your degree was awarded in any of the above countries, an official transcript of records must be sent directly from your university to the SECCLO Admissions Office in a sealed envelope. In addition to the transcript, the envelope can contain only official documents awarded by the university (e.g. degree certificate, diploma supplement, or translations of the documents). Transcripts handled or delivered by the applicant will not be accepted.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        The transcript of records must be certified with an original stamp of the university and an original signature of the certifying officer. Regular photocopies are not accepted. The envelope must be sealed by the awarding institution’s official stamp across the back flap.
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Bangladesh
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        If your degree is awarded in Bangladesh, the copies of the degree certificate and transcript of records have to be certified by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Bangladesh. Each page of the transcript of records and the degree certificate must carry the original stamp and signature by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Bangladesh. Copies of the certified documents will not be accepted.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <a href="http://mofa.gov.bd" rel="noopener noreferrer" style="color: #808080;" target="_blank">
         Further information can be found on the Ministry’s website
        </a>
        (mofa.gov.bd).
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Canada
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Degree certificate
        </strong>
        : The copy of the degree certificate must be stamped and signed by the issuing institution or a notary public. Please see above for further information (
        <em>
         Official attestation of copies
        </em>
        ). You are not required to submit a copy of your degree certificate if your transcript of records confers the degree and includes the following information: name of the institution awarding the degree, title/name of the degree, name of the student, date of award of the degree.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Transcript of records
        </strong>
        : If your degree was awarded in Canada, an official transcript of records must be sent directly from your university to SECCLO Admissions Office in a sealed envelope. In addition to the transcript, the envelope can contain only official documents awarded by the university (e.g. degree certificate, diploma supplement, or translations of the documents). Transcripts handled or delivered by the applicant will not be accepted.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        The transcript of records must be certified with an original stamp of the university and an original signature of the certifying officer. Regular photocopies are not accepted. The envelope must be sealed by the awarding institution’s official stamp across the back flap. Envelopes sealed with a generic stamp are not accepted.
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        China (Mainland)
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Degree certificate
        </strong>
        : A verification report of your degree certificate in English by CSSD (Center for Student Services and Development) is required. The verification report in English must be sent to SECCLO Admissions Office at
        <a class="mgd_spmspn" href="mailto:secclo@aalto.fi" style="color: #808080;">
         secclo@aalto.fi
        </a>
        . Take into account the processing time and start the verification process well in advance. For further information, please visit the
        <a href="https://www.chsi.com.cn/" rel="noopener" style="color: #808080;" target="_blank">
         CSSD website
        </a>
        (www.chsi.com.cn).
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Transcript of records
        </strong>
        : If your degree is awarded in mainland China, a verification report of your transcript of records in English by CSSD (Center for Student Services and Development) is required. Apply to CSSD for a verification report of your transcript of records in English. The verification report must be sent to SECCLO Admissions Office at
        <a class="mgd_spmspn" href="mailto:secclo@aalto.fi" style="color: #808080;">
         secclo@aalto.fi
        </a>
        . Take into account the processing time of CSSD and start the verification process well in advance. Further information is on the
        <a href="https://www.chsi.com.cn/" rel="noopener" style="color: #808080;" target="_blank">
         CSSD website
        </a>
        (www.chsi.com.cn).
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        India
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Degree certificate
        </strong>
        : The copy of the degree certificate must be stamped and signed by the issuing institution or a notary public. Please see above for further information (
        <em>
         Official attestation of copies
        </em>
        ).
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        SECCLO accepts also an officially certified electronic copy of the degree certificate sent via
        <a href="http://www.electronictranscripts.com/" rel="noopener" style="color: #808080;" target="_blank">
         Truecopy
        </a>
        . Request your degree certificate to be submitted to
        <a class="mgd_spmspn" href="mailto:secclo@aalto.fi" style="color: #808080;">
         secclo@aalto.fi
        </a>
        directly from the Truecopy service.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Transcript of records
        </strong>
        : If your degree is awarded in India, an official transcript of records must be delivered to SECCLO Admissions Office in the institution’s sealed envelope. The envelope must be sealed by the awarding institution’s official stamp across the back flap. The transcript of records must be certified with an original stamp of the university and an original signature of the certifying officer. Regular photocopies are not accepted.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        If the institution does not re-issue official transcripts, photocopies of the original documents must be attested by the Controller of Examinations or Registrar and delivered to SECCLO Admissions Office in the institution’s sealed envelope. You can mail the sealed envelope yourself. In addition to the transcript, the envelope can contain only official documents awarded by the university (e.g. degree certificate or diploma supplement).
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        SECCLO accepts also official electronic transcripts (e-transcripts) sent via
        <a href="http://www.electronictranscripts.com/" rel="noopener" style="color: #808080;" target="_blank">
         Truecopy
        </a>
        . Request your electronic transcript to be submitted to
        <a class="mgd_spmspn" href="mailto:secclo@aalto.fi" style="color: #808080;">
         secclo@aalto.fi
        </a>
        directly from the Truecopy service.
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Iran
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        If your degree is awarded in Iran, the copies of the educational documents must be legalized by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Iran and the Embassy of Finland in Tehran. All the copies must have the original stamp given by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Iran and the Embassy of Finland in Tehran. Copies of certified documents will not be accepted. Official translations of educational documents must be certified by the Ministry of Justice.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Original transcripts issued in English by the university are accepted if the transcript arrives in the university’s sealed envelope. The envelope must be sealed by the awarding institution’s official stamp across the back flap. You can mail the sealed envelope yourself.
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Nepal
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Degree certificate
        </strong>
        : The copy of the degree certificate must be stamped and signed by the issuing institution or a notary public. Please see above for further information (
        <em>
         Official attestation of copies
        </em>
        ).
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Transcript of records
        </strong>
        : If you degree is awarded in Nepal, an official transcript of records must be sent directly from your university to SECCLO Admissions Office in a sealed envelope. In addition to the transcript, the envelope can contain only official documents awarded by the university (e.g. degree certificate, diploma supplement, or translations of the documents).
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        The transcript of records must be certified with an original stamp of the university and an original signature of the certifying officer. Regular photocopies are not accepted. The envelope must be sealed by the awarding institution’s official stamp across the back flap.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        If your university is not able to send the transcript, please request for the document to be attested by the Controller of Examinations or the Registrar and to be placed in an official sealed envelope. You can submit the sealed envelope yourself. Transcripts or mark sheets attested by persons outside the Controller of Examination or Registrar’s Offices will not be accepted.
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Pakistan
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        If your degree is awarded in Pakistan, the copy of your degree certificate and transcript of records have to be attested by the Higher Education Commission (HEC) in Pakistan. Each page of the copies of the degree certificate and the transcript of records must have the
        <strong>
         original attestation stamp
        </strong>
        and signature of the HEC official. Regular copies of attested documents will not be accepted. The authenticity of the qualifications will be verified with the HEC.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        For more information, please see the HEC website (hec.gov.pk).
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        United Kingdom and Ireland
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Degree certificate
        </strong>
        : The copy of the degree certificate must be stamped and signed by the issuing institution or a notary public. Please see above for further information (
        <em>
         Official attestation of copies
        </em>
        ).
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Transcript of records
        </strong>
        : If your degree was awarded in the United Kingdom or Ireland, an official transcript of records must be sent directly from your university to SECCLO Admissions Office in a sealed envelope. In addition to the transcript, the envelope can contain only official documents awarded by the university (e.g. degree certificate or diploma supplement). Transcripts handled or delivered by the applicant will not be accepted.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        The transcript of records must be certified with an original stamp of the university and an original signature of the certifying officer. Regular photocopies are not accepted. The envelope must be sealed by the awarding institution’s official stamp across the back flap.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        For the degrees completed in the United Kingdom, an official HEAR (Higher Education Achievement Report) sent via Gradintelligence is also accepted. The HEAR has to be sent directly through Gradintelligence to SECCLO Admissions Office (
        <a class="mgd_spmspn" href="mailto:secclo@aalto.fi" style="color: #808080;">
         secclo@aalto.fi
        </a>
        ).
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
     <details>
      <summary>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        United States of America
       </span>
      </summary>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Degree certificate
        </strong>
        : The copy of the degree certificate must be stamped and signed by the issuing institution or a notary public. Please see above for further information (
        <em>
         Official attestation of copies
        </em>
        ). You are not required to submit a copy of your degree certificate if your transcript of records confers the degree and includes the following information: name of the institution awarding the degree, title/name of the degree, name of the student, date of award of the degree.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        <strong>
         Transcript of records
        </strong>
        : If your degree was awarded in the USA, an official transcript of records must be sent directly from your university to SECCLO Admissions Office in a sealed envelope. In addition to the transcript, the envelope can contain only official documents awarded by the university (e.g. degree certificate or diploma supplement). Transcripts handled or delivered by the applicant will not be accepted.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        The transcript of records must be certified with an original stamp of the university and an original signature of the certifying officer. Regular photocopies are not accepted. The envelope must be sealed by the awarding institution’s official stamp across the back flap.
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        Electronic transcripts sent via Parchment Exchange, National Student Clearinghouse and eSCRIP-SAFE or in secure PDF format are also accepted. The PDF transcript has to contain the blue certification ribbon and it has to be sent directly from the issuing university’s Office of the Registrar to SECCLO Admissions Office (
        <a class="mgd_spmspn" href="mailto:secclo@aalto.fi" style="color: #808080;">
         secclo@aalto.fi
        </a>
        ).
       </span>
      </p>
     </details>
    </div>
   </div>
