     <h2>
      Student testimonials
     </h2>
     <div class="subheader">
     </div>
     <p>
      <img alt="" class="size-medium wp-image-6512 alignright" data-pagespeed-url-hash="2919081233" decoding="async" height="300" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" sizes="(max-width: 200px) 100vw, 200px" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/cd6af788-gianni-reduced-jpg-200x300.jpg" srcset="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/cd6af788-gianni-reduced-jpg-200x300.jpg 200w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/cd6af788-gianni-reduced-jpg-683x1024.jpg 683w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/cd6af788-gianni-reduced-jpg-768x1152.jpg 768w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/cd6af788-gianni-reduced-jpg-1024x1536.jpg 1024w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/cd6af788-gianni-reduced-jpg-1365x2048.jpg 1365w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/cd6af788-gianni-reduced-jpg-700x1050.jpg 700w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/cd6af788-gianni-reduced-jpg-640x960.jpg 640w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/cd6af788-gianni-reduced-jpg-600x900.jpg 600w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/cd6af788-gianni-reduced-jpg-rotated.jpg 1523w" width="200"/>
     </p>
     <h3>
      Gianni, Italy, Intake 2023
     </h3>
     <p>
      <strong>
       What did you learn during the internship?
      </strong>
      <br/>
      My internship was in research at Aalto’s CS department, where I specialised in Platform Security. Here I learnt how to delve deeper into a specific topic (in my case TPMs) and the tiring and rewarding experience of working at the forefront of a field.
      <br/>
      A big plus: it was very useful for job interviews for my thesis, as it was a good ice-breaker topic with recruiters!
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Where are you doing your second year studies and what are your expectations? How has it been so far?
      </strong>
      <br/>
      I am studying at DTU in Denmark, here the approach is similar to Aalto where practical work prevails, but at DTU most of the courses are based on group work. I also had the opportunity to try out a course that mixes technical knowledge with entrepreneurship; we developed a big project during the semester by treating it as a part-time job. This gave me a good boost in soft skills, such as leadership, collaboration and communication.
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       In your opinion, what are the advantages of studying in SECCLO?
      </strong>
      <br/>
      The biggest advantage I see in my experience at SECCLO is the connections. Already in the first weeks in Finland, I could feel the diversity of backgrounds among my classmates, both in terms of work or study experience and culture. Nevertheless, we bonded quickly, especially during the first semester, when most activities were common to all group members. And now, we are spread across Europe getting to know new people but keeping the connection between classmates and entering the greater network of SECCLO students from all batches.
     </p>
     <p>
     </p>
     <h3>
      Sonika, Nepal, Intake 2023
      <img alt="" class="size-medium wp-image-6508 alignleft" data-pagespeed-url-hash="1392048165" decoding="async" height="300" loading="lazy" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" sizes="(max-width: 225px) 100vw, 225px" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/b83159ed-sonika-reduced-225x300.jpg" srcset="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/b83159ed-sonika-reduced-225x300.jpg 225w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/b83159ed-sonika-reduced-768x1024.jpg 768w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/b83159ed-sonika-reduced-1152x1536.jpg 1152w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/b83159ed-sonika-reduced-700x933.jpg 700w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/b83159ed-sonika-reduced-640x853.jpg 640w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/b83159ed-sonika-reduced-600x800.jpg 600w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/b83159ed-sonika-reduced.jpg 1512w" width="225"/>
     </h3>
     <p>
      <strong>
       What did you learn during the internship?
       <br/>
      </strong>
      I did my internship in Cybernetica at Estonia where I was in research programming position. I took a lot of knowledge from the courses Information Security, Platform Security and Cloud Software Systems that I took in first year of Aalto. My position was under Information Security Research Institute of Cybernetica which gave me opportunity to be part of research team and to be engaged in weekly seminar session, project planning meetings and many more. I will carry on this experience with me and this internship has given me confidence to move forward in my academic career.
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Where are you doing your second year studies and what are your expectations?
      </strong>
      <strong>
       How has it been so far?
       <br/>
      </strong>
      My second year studies is in NTNU, Trondheim. I am looking forward to completing the courses that I have started. The courses I am taking are Secure Cryptographic Implementations, Wireless Network Security, Advance Ethical Hacking, Critical Infrastructure Security. The teaching team are very resourceful, extremely motivating to students, and helpful. I have also become big fan of Norway and its nature. I really like walking around, hiking here and I am looking forward to skiing here.
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       What would you like to say to somebody who is considering to apply to SECCLO?
       <br/>
      </strong>
      SECCLO gave me opportunity to study in two fine universities in Finland and Norway. I have so many experiences throughout my Masters program and these experiences has made me a better person. If someone is thinking of applying to the program, I encourage them to apply. You will always have family in SECCLO, the alumni are super active and very helpful.
     </p>
     <h3>
      Ionut, Romania, Intake 2023
     </h3>
     <p>
      <strong>
       What did you learn during the internship?
       <img alt="" class="size-medium wp-image-6515 alignright" data-pagespeed-url-hash="525051902" decoding="async" height="300" loading="lazy" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" sizes="(max-width: 203px) 100vw, 203px" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/1f7415c4-ionut-smaller-and-reduced-203x300.jpg" srcset="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/1f7415c4-ionut-smaller-and-reduced-203x300.jpg 203w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/1f7415c4-ionut-smaller-and-reduced-693x1024.jpg 693w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/1f7415c4-ionut-smaller-and-reduced-700x1035.jpg 700w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/1f7415c4-ionut-smaller-and-reduced-640x946.jpg 640w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/1f7415c4-ionut-smaller-and-reduced-600x887.jpg 600w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/1f7415c4-ionut-smaller-and-reduced.jpg 702w" width="203"/>
      </strong>
      <br/>
      The internship was a school in itself for me. Besides the rewarding processes of finding solutions to problems that haven’t been solved before, I also developed invaluable skills that would help me be a better engineer. I witnessed how to enable a successful project, first of all, by combining the different perspectives and approaches to problem-solving of all team members. Further, I learned how to ensure alignment on the project at every step, by communicating efficiently with the project supervisor. Advancing the project required consistency, reading documentation (a lot), diving deep into code snippets and tutorials, and more heavy-lifting work involving knowledge in networking, security, and deployment. I also found accountability to be essential. This enabled me to take ownership of my responsibilities and learn from my mistakes but also allowed the supervisor and other coworkers to give me feedback: point out where I was doing fine and help me when I was getting stuck. Apart from the invaluable learning outcomes and the rewarding feeling of a successful project delivery, I also witnessed the undergoing work in security and cloud deployments at Aalto. This allowed me to build relationships with professors, PhD students, and SECCLO alumni and get a stronger understanding of the world of academia.
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Where are you doing your second year studies and what are your expectations?
      </strong>
      <strong>
       How has it been so far?
      </strong>
      <br/>
      My second-year studies are at Eurecom, following the Big-data platforms security track. This focuses on cloud and distributed systems together with the associated intricacies of map-reduce and the need for higher-level mechanisms such as Apache Spark (the state-of-the-art in data analytics). According to my semester project, I will be taking a step further to explore how to embed security and privacy into the computation performed by such systems, without paralyzing performance or limiting the plethora of use cases. On the soft skills side, I also enjoy learning about leadership, management, finance, and business. As a complete experience, I also got the chance to visit stunning places around the French Riviera and experience warm weather for the winter.
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       What would you like to say to somebody who is considering to apply to SECCLO?
      </strong>
      <br/>
      SECCLO provides a trustworthy frame for exploring opportunities. From Aalto to the summer school and the exit university, it offers high-quality programs and courses, hands-on experience, countless possibilities, and even more learning opportunities. Even if you can envision yourself clearly regarding your career, SECCLO is still overly enriching. In other words, expect your vision to be challenged.
     </p>
     <p>
     </p>
     <h3 style="text-align: right;">
      <img alt="" class="size-medium wp-image-6503 alignleft" data-pagespeed-url-hash="222834773" decoding="async" height="300" loading="lazy" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" sizes="(max-width: 246px) 100vw, 246px" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/efbd4788-viktoriia_kovalenko_portrait-002-246x300.jpg" srcset="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/efbd4788-viktoriia_kovalenko_portrait-002-246x300.jpg 246w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/efbd4788-viktoriia_kovalenko_portrait-002-841x1024.jpg 841w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/efbd4788-viktoriia_kovalenko_portrait-002-768x935.jpg 768w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/efbd4788-viktoriia_kovalenko_portrait-002-700x853.jpg 700w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/efbd4788-viktoriia_kovalenko_portrait-002-640x779.jpg 640w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/efbd4788-viktoriia_kovalenko_portrait-002-600x731.jpg 600w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/12/efbd4788-viktoriia_kovalenko_portrait-002.jpg 1051w" width="246"/>
      Viktoriia, Ukraine, Intake 2023
     </h3>
     <p style="text-align: right;">
      <strong>
       What did you learn during the internship?
      </strong>
      <br/>
      This summer I worked as a Research Intern at Ericsson. During my internship, I conducted research independently, set research goals, and took the initiative to present my findings. My work focused on doing a literature review in LLMs and benchmarking them. I also practiced working with DevOps tools and participated in a synthetic data generation project. In my view, the most valuable achievements of my internship go beyond gaining technical knowledge. While working in the company, I developed soft skills and learnt to identify potential research topics. This experience and skills will provide a solid foundation for my future career.
     </p>
     <p style="text-align: right;">
      <strong>
       Where are you doing your second year studies and what are
      </strong>
      <br/>
      <strong>
       your expectations? How has it been so far?
       <br/>
      </strong>
      My second year is in EURECOM with a specialization in Big Data Security. So far I am enjoying my studies although the workload is quite intensive. What I appreciate most about this university is the deeper focus on specialized research topics compared to the more general courses I completed during my first year at Aalto University. This year my studies have less traditional academic work and more career-oriented specialization so now I consider myself more of a professional than a student. Each day I explore a wide range of research topics, and I hope that by the end of the semester, I will have a big picture of current security issues and trends.
     </p>
     <p style="text-align: right;">
      <strong>
       In your opinion, what are the advantages of studying in
      </strong>
      <strong>
       SECCLO?
      </strong>
      <br/>
      My background was in Data Science and I was hesitant about its application in the cybersecurity domain. However, I can now say with confidence that the knowledge and skills gained in the SECCLO program will be invaluable for every career path. I would highly recommend the SECCLO program for anyone seeking profound knowledge in cybersecurity, cloud computing and DevOps. Additionally, our Planning Officers, Emma Tuomola and Eija Kujanpää have provided immense and immediate support throughout the program, so you will never be left without guidance. SECCLO also offers a great opportunity to connect with international students, build strong connections and join a proud community of SECCLO alumni.
     </p>
     <p>
     </p>

     <h3>
      Alessandro, Italy, Intake 2021
     </h3>
     <p>
      <img alt="" class="size-medium wp-image-6052 alignright" data-pagespeed-url-hash="771244150" decoding="async" height="300" loading="lazy" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" sizes="(max-width: 225px) 100vw, 225px" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2022/10/29503250-alessandro-chiarelli-original-225x300.jpg" srcset="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2022/10/29503250-alessandro-chiarelli-original-225x300.jpg 225w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2022/10/29503250-alessandro-chiarelli-original-768x1024.jpg 768w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2022/10/29503250-alessandro-chiarelli-original-700x934.jpg 700w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2022/10/29503250-alessandro-chiarelli-original-640x854.jpg 640w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2022/10/29503250-alessandro-chiarelli-original.jpg 958w" width="225"/>
      <strong>
       What did you learn during the internship?
      </strong>
      <br/>
      My internship was with Amazon in Spain and I worked as a software development engineer. My job was to develop internal automation tools for our data scientists building machine learning models for the search function on Amazon marketplace. I got to learn plenty about working in the industry, mainly what a “true” Agile workplace is, how to talk to our customers and define requirements according to their necessities, how to work in a team with people having different seniorities and across timezones (part of the team was in the US west coast and part was in Spain). Of course, I also learnt about internal processes and technologies used in Amazon, as well as some cloud technologies used on AWS.
     </p>
     <p>
      I also learnt Spanish, which is always useful. Finally, the other fellow interns in my team and I were lucky enough to be the first ever European interns to go on a business trip to San Francisco to meet the other half of our team!
     </p>

      <summary>
       > Click here to continue reading
      </summary>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Where are you doing your second-year studies, and what are your expectations? How has it been so far?
       </strong>
       <br/>
       I am studying in Tartu, Estonia and I’m enjoying it so far. I like how the evaluation process works for most subjects and that there is a very practical mindset – I’m learning how to do stuff, not the theory behind it. This is something that I value highly in the last year of my studies before I go to the industry. The professors here are very kind and available towards helping you build a more personalized academic curriculum. For example, the reason why I got into cryptography were blockchain and cryptocurrencies, and I was allowed to take two blockchain courses even if originally they weren’t part of the core curriculum. This motivates me highly and helps me learn about things that I always cared about.
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        What would you like to say to somebody who is considering applying to SECCLO?
       </strong>
       <br/>
       First of all, contact someone who is participating to it now, or has recently graduated, so that you can get dive deep into the programme and ask all of the questions you might have, whether practical or just curiosities. I personally believe that the strength of SECCLO relies in its network. SECCLO (and its predecessor NordSecMob) have been around for a while, so there is a network of companies that know about it and, most importantly, there is a network of former students around the world. In my opinion the secret to success in this field is having a great network, because if you do, you can always find someone who can help you. And the SECCLO network isn’t just a network, it’s more of a family, as different batches keep in contact and help each other out. Finally, the consortium’s universities are among the best ones in Europe for this field and offer top notch education; pair it up with great student life… what more are you looking for?
      </p>

     <p>
      <img alt="" class="size-medium wp-image-6063 alignleft" data-pagespeed-url-hash="708015823" decoding="async" height="300" loading="lazy" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" sizes="(max-width: 225px) 100vw, 225px" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2022/10/029fe687-jayshree-rathi-smaller-225x300.jpeg" srcset="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2022/10/029fe687-jayshree-rathi-smaller-225x300.jpeg 225w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2022/10/029fe687-jayshree-rathi-smaller.jpeg 443w" width="225"/>
      <strong>
       What did you learn during the internship?
      </strong>
      <br/>
      My internship with Ericsson was a great learning opportunity for me. It started quite early as a part-time internship during the spring semester, which later turned into a full-time internship during the summer. The chance of working part-time as an intern while studying taught me a great deal about time management and accountability.
     </p>
     <p>
      As a software developer intern for Ericsson, I was mostly responsible for the backend development of ESM (Ericsson Security Manager). In this role, I got to practically implement the concepts I learned during my first year at Aalto while getting a chance to broaden my technical repertoire. My tasks were assigned in such a way that they align with my interests, and I would learn the most from them. I was also given a chance to host meetings and stand-ups, which boosted my confidence and honed my presentation and communication skills. In addition, I learned to better fit in a cross-cultural team and improve my overall team working abilities. I have enjoyed my internship experience and I remain quite amazed and fascinated by the Finnish working culture.
     </p>

      <summary>
       > Click here to continue reading
      </summary>

         Where are you doing your second-year studies, and what are your expectations? How has it been so far?
        </strong>
        <br/>
       </strong>
       For the second year of my studies, I chose to study at KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm, Sweden. KTH has some really interesting courses, many of which are very hands-on and offer a lot to learn from. I got particularly interested in the subjects Ethical Hacking, and Communication System Design Project while applying to KTH, as they had new topics for me to explore. I gained a lot of new expertise regarding a field I was oblivious to, and I am still learning. There’s room for everyone to grow in KTH.
      </p>
      <p>
       Besides studies, the courses here for SECCLO are very well-balanced, and there is enough time to explore the city and its vivid culture, which is the best part for me. I love roaming around the city streets and exploring new cafeterias, malls and sometimes just enjoying the view and fresh air of the Swedish east coast. Sweden and Finland feel so similar, and yet are very different in so many ways. But in both of the countries, I am enjoying a very beautiful Nordic lifestyle.
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        What would you like to say to somebody who is considering applying to SECCLO?

       <br/>
       SECCLO is such a broad program and yet is very welcoming to students from many backgrounds. It presents you with possibilities that could pave your way for a successful career in a booming industry. In fact, SECCLO is more than the courses and the master’s degrees it offers. When you join SECCLO, you become part of a unique family, with an immensely helpful alumni network, and classmates who turn into friends for life. The courses, covering advanced topics, can be challenging and overwhelming at times, but it is equally rewarding as you get to closely learn about state-of-the-art technologies.
      </p>
      <p>
       For me, SECCLO provided a holistic experience of studying and graduating from two of the world’s finest universities alongside brilliant and talented individuals from around the globe and growing around a student culture unlike anywhere else. It is an experience I will cherish for my lifetime, and I want every aspiring student to have a similar experience. To all the students considering applying, I’d suggest, “Just, Go for it!”. I know you’ll have your doubts, as I had mine too. But the hustle is definitely worth it!

     <h3>

     <h3>

      <strong>

      </strong>
      <br/>
      In contrast to my peers, I had a very easy time receiving an internship position. I wasn’t some magical super-student but simply employed already at the Finnish company Smartly.io. Initially, and before SECCLO, I was hired as a full-stack software engineer. However, for my internship, I wanted to do something different and perhaps more in line with the studies at SECCLO. So I proposed to Smartly that I’d do an internal rotation to the DevOps team, which they excitedly facilitated.
     </p>
     <details>
      <summary>
       > Click here to continue reading
      </summary>
      <p>
       I can honestly say that the most important thing I learned from my internship was how helpful, flexible, and understanding Finnish tech companies are. I’m not the only one with a similar story, you’ll find plenty of students on campus with similar experiences with “the industry”. If you’re looking for a highly engaging and, simply put, chill working environment, then an internship in Finland is nothing to miss. (Quick remark: this is not to say that I gained no technical skills; quite the contrary, I learned so much about actual DevOps workflows and even got to work/lead a project affecting the whole engineering department at Smartly!)

      </p>
      <p>
       As for the studies, I am expecting high-quality classes from excellent professors within my field of interest, namely cloud services and security (as well as malware analysis and reverse engineering). I am also expecting a slightly different working culture and environment.
       <br/>
       Having studied most of my time in Finland I am grateful that this program is partly abroad, I find that to be a great opportunity to learn about different cultures.
      </p>

According to my knowledge, almost everyone from my batch got several internship and full-time job offers because of the emerging need for qualified engineers and researchers in the field of security and cloud computing. As a recent alumna of the programme, I can say that they shouldn’t worry about either one of these issues! The education system is built in such a way that you don’t need to memorize, but rather think and understand. Of course, we studied a lot during the two-year programme, but overall, computer science and especially security are fields whereyou need to learn and develop constantly. After gaining such a mindset, there are no boundaries in finding a place to work after the SECCLO programme, because you will know your strengths, professional goals and dreams.
      </p>
      <p>
       I am currently a Backend Software Engineer at Tink in Stockholm, Sweden. My work focuses on building a PaaS for financial institutes and banks across Europe. I can say I definitely benefit from my knowledge of application security at my work a lot, since the security in the fintech industry is significant.
      </p>
     </details>
     <p>
     </p>
     <h3>
      Ahmed Beder, Egypt, Intake 2018
     </h3>
     <p>
      <img alt="" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-4756" data-pagespeed-url-hash="380121034" decoding="async" height="266" loading="lazy" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/10/e6875e04-ahmed.jpg" style="float: left; margin-right: 10px;" width="200"/>
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       How would you describe your SECCLO studies?
      </strong>
      During the first year of SECCLO, there was a broad range of subjects, both security-oriented and cloud-related, which we needed to have a solid background in. While some courses were more challenging than others, I enjoyed every single course I took. I studied a lot during the first year. Still, I also traveled a lot and became friends with almost everyone on the campus. By living in Otaniemi student campus, I got to participate in the constant events and social activities organized by the student chapters (guilds as they are called in Finland).
     </p>
     <details>
      <summary>
       > Click here to continue reading
      </summary>
      <p>
       At the end of our first year, we had a chance to travel to the stunningly beautiful Trondheim for an intense summer school on blockchains and cryptocurrencies. It was busy, tiring, and very challenging, but amazing in every way. We all ate our meals together and experienced Norwegian culture. The best part was the never-ending sunshine. It was sunny all the way until midnight.
      </p>
      <p>
       My summer internship took place in NIXU, a security consultancy firm, which helped me learn about the Finnish working life. I could really see the knowledge I gained translate into actual work in the industry. Also, I was lucky to be able to take part on their annual convention in Estonia. There I could see a lot of people as passionate about security as I am.
      </p>
      <p>
       As for the second year of my programme, I went to KTH in Sweden and worked on my Master’s thesis project at Ericsson. Most of my courses in KTH were practical and hands-on, which let me do a lot of individual learning. The thesis took most of my time, and I found coordinating my work between multiple universities and an industry partner challenging but ultimately rewarding.
      </p>
      <p>
       Overall, the academic curriculum, administrative procedure, and professional and personal growth from the program are incredible. I wholeheartedly recommend SECCLO to students with a passion for security and cloud.
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        In your opinion, what are the advantages of studying at SECCLO?
       </strong>
       In my opinion, the best part of the SECCLO programme is the deep industry cooperation and focusing on real-life practical challenges rather than teaching too much theory. We didn’t have any issues finding a summer internship in Finland due to the university’s broad network, referral of NordSecMob (SECCLO predecessor) students, and well-organized administrative processes. The studies are organized so that a person is responsible for their own tempo and can ask for help from professors if needed. Most importantly, professors at Aalto and KTH enjoy their work and are happy to provide students with more advanced materials. Moreover, after the end of my first year, I clearly understood if I wanted to focus on research or industry based on my personal and professional goals. That is truly an amazing aspect about this programme.
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        What would you like to say to a potential SECCLO applicant considering their choices?
       </strong>
       The time that I spent during SECCLO was definitely a great time to grow professionally and personally. If a person is genuinely interested in applying to SECCLO, I recommend starting the application process as early as possible. Start preparing your documents from October. Write a genuine motivation letter. Follow the guidelines on the website and do not miss the deadlines. SECCLO is a programme worth the effort. If you are selected, you will have two wonderful years. You’ll meet amazing people and never regret it.
      </p>
      <p>
       I am currently working as a Junior Site Reliability Engineer at SEBx, a part of SEB bank in Sweden. My work focuses on security configurations, so I bring a security perspective to my team with my understanding of threat modeling and network security.
      </p>
     </details>
     <p>
     </p>
     <h3>
      Satenik, Armenia, Intake 2018
     </h3>
     <p>
      <strong>
       <img alt="" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-4783" data-pagespeed-url-hash="3864729981" decoding="async" height="300" loading="lazy" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2020/11/4b107bbb-satenik.jpg" style="float: right; margin-left: 10px;" width="200"/>
       How would you describe your SECCLO studies?
      </strong>
      These two years have helped me develop a lot, both professionally and personally. And the best part of the journey has been the people: meeting some of the best experts in the field, getting to know people from other cultures and making friends for life is what made it unforgettable.
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       In your opinion, what are the advantages of studying in SECCLO?
      </strong>
      The environment at the universities in general and among SECCLO students in particular is very diverse. My friends and classmates come from almost all continents and have different backgrounds. One has 10 years of work experience, while the other comes straight from their Bachelor’s, one enjoys competing in Capture The Flags, while the other has never done any hacking but has incredible math skills. I believe the programme has enough flexibility for each individual to focus on what interests them the most, gain the skills they lack, and strengthen their strengths.
     </p>
     <details>
      <summary>
       > Click here to continue reading
      </summary>
      <p>
       <strong>
        What would you like to say to a potential SECCLO applicant considering their choices?
       </strong>
       To people hesitating about joining the programme, I absolutely encourage to take that step. You will have your highs and lows, but you will definitely grow a lot. At the end, the programme will give you an immense range of career opportunities, be it cybersecurity or software engineering in any country or an academic career at a top-rated university.
      </p>
     </details>
     <p>
     </p>

   </div>

     <h2>
      For selected students
     </h2>
     <div class="subheader">
      <p>
       Congratulations for being selected to SECCLO! On this website, you will find further information on the next steps to take for preparing your arrival to Finland and starting your studies.
      </p>
     </div>
     <h3>
      <a href="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2023/11/84ebc5a6-secclo-handbook-2023_final.pdf" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       SECCLO handbook 2023
      </a>
     </h3>
     <p>
      <img alt="" class="alignnone wp-image-5894 size-medium" data-pagespeed-url-hash="2464345395" decoding="async" height="300" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" sizes="(max-width: 212px) 100vw, 212px" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2021/12/bb1d90b4-secclo-handbook-2021_kuvake_page_01-212x300.png" srcset="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2021/12/bb1d90b4-secclo-handbook-2021_kuvake_page_01-212x300.png 212w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2021/12/bb1d90b4-secclo-handbook-2021_kuvake_page_01-768x1086.png 768w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2021/12/bb1d90b4-secclo-handbook-2021_kuvake_page_01-724x1024.png 724w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2021/12/bb1d90b4-secclo-handbook-2021_kuvake_page_01-700x990.png 700w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2021/12/bb1d90b4-secclo-handbook-2021_kuvake_page_01-640x905.png 640w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2021/12/bb1d90b4-secclo-handbook-2021_kuvake_page_01-1600x2263.png 1600w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2021/12/bb1d90b4-secclo-handbook-2021_kuvake_page_01.png 1654w" width="212"/>
     </p>
     <h4>
      Student meetings 2024
     </h4>
     <p>
      4 April 2024: Welcome event for new students in Zoom. See the
      <a href="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/04/9f6990c8-meeting-for-secclo-2024-students-04042024_.pdf" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       information slides here
      </a>
      and the
      <a href="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/04/5dddb153-secclo-student-life-2024.pdf" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       student stories slides here.
      </a>
     </p>
     <p>
      2 May 2024: Second webinar for new students. See the
      <a href="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/05/b8940305-new-students-meeting-02052024.pdf" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       slides here (administrative).
      </a>
      Slides of Prof. Tuomas Aura
      <a href="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2024/05/183462b0-secclo-new-student-webinar-2024-05-02.pdf" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       you can find here.
      </a>
     </p>
     <p>
      25 June 2024: Third webinar for new students (getting to know each other) in Zoom
     </p>
     <h3>
      Information for students selected in 2024 student intake
     </h3>
     <h4>
      <span style="color: #3366ff;">
       Checklist: what to do after being selected to SECCLO programme
      </span>
     </h4>
     <p>
      1.
      <strong>
       Accept your admission offer at Studyinfo.fi
      </strong>
      by the given deadline. Instructions have been sent by email (see Welcome letter). Please note that
      <em>
       students may accept only one study place leading to a higher education degree in Finland during one academic term (One study place per term provision (Universities Act 558/2009))
      </em>
      . Once you have accepted the offer, the acceptance cannot be cancelled. If you do not accept the admission offer in Study Info -portal by the given deadline, your admission to SECCLO programme and possible scholarship will be automatically cancelled.
     </p>
     <details>
      <summary>
       Are you already an Aalto University student and wish to accept a new study place? click to open
      </summary>
      <p>
       If you already have a right to study at a Master’s programme in Aalto University, please note that you can have only one valid right to study towards the same degree. If a student accepts a new study place in a Master’s programme (for instance, leading to the degree of Master of Science in Technology) the old Master of Science in Technology right to study is forfeited.
      </p>
     </details>
     <p>
      2.
      <em>
       Self-funded students
      </em>
      : We will send you the invoice for the first academic year after you have confirmed your participation.
      <strong>
       Send a receipt of the paid participation cost
      </strong>
      as a scanned copy to secclo(at)aalto.fi by the given deadline.
     </p>
     <p>
      3.
      <strong>
       Conditional acceptance
      </strong>
      : Submit attested copies of your degree certificate and transcript of records to SECCLO Admission Office
      <em>
       as soon as possible
      </em>
      (but by 8th August 2024 at the latest). Please inform us once you have sent the documents. See
      <a href="https://secclo.eu/admission/application-documents/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       Application documents
      </a>
      for instructions and pay attention to the country-specific requirements if applicable.
      <strong>
       Your acceptance is conditional until you submit the documents as requested. If you fail to do this, the conditionally granted study right will be cancelled.
      </strong>
     </p>
     <details>
      <summary>
       >If you applied with an incomplete degree, please click here for more information
      </summary>
      <p>
       According to SECCLO’s admission procedure, all students selected with an incomplete Bachelor’s degree will need to graduate
       <strong>
        by 31 July 2024
       </strong>
       and submit officially attested copies of the degree certificate and the transcript of records by mail by 8 August 2024.
       <strong>
        If you fail to do this or do not graduate in time, the conditionally granted study right will be cancelled
       </strong>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        You have different options, depending on your situation
       </strong>
       :
      </p>
      <p>
       1) Mail us the documents (with official translations, if not in English). The paper copies of the documents need to comply with our country-specific document requirements. If there are no country-specific requirements that apply to the country of the instution that awarded your degree, the copy needs to be stamped and signed either by the issuing university or a notary public. Please see further instructions at
       <a href="https://secclo.eu/admission/application-documents/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        Application documents
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <p>
       2)
       <strong>
        If you are uncertain whether you can get the copy of your degree certificate attested and delivered by the deadline
       </strong>
       : Send us by email the copies of your degree certificate and transcript of records. If you have not yet received the degree certificate, we can accept a provisional degree certificate or a statement (in English) from your university confirming that you have completed all credits (incl. thesis, if applicable) by 31 July 2024. This statement must be sent by email to secclo(at)aalto.fi by 8th August. In this case, you will need to bring your original degree certificate, final transcript and their translations (if applicable) with you when you arrive to Aalto University.
      </p>
     </details>
     <p>
      4.
      <strong>
       Insurance
      </strong>
      : All enrolled SECCLO students are covered by an insurance scheme by insurance company Dr-Walter. This insurance meets the minimum health and accident coverage requested by the European Commission. According to the Erasmus Mundus Joint Master EMJMD regulations, coverage starts maximum 2 months before the official inception date and ends maximum 3 months after the official end of the programme. This is stated on the insurance or on a separate note.
     </p>
     <p>
      5.
      <strong>
       Return other required documents
      </strong>
      , such as student agreement, by given deadlines. Instructions are sent by email.
     </p>
     <p>
      6.
      <strong>
       Apply for a residence permit
      </strong>
      (non-EU/EEA citizens) or book an appointment in order to
      <a href="https://migri.fi/en/registration-of-right-of-residence" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       register your residence
      </a>
      at the Finnish Immigration Service (EU/EEA citizens). EU/EEA citizens do not need to apply for residence permit.
     </p>
     <details>
      <summary>
       > FAQ about residence permit, please click here
      </summary>
      <blockquote>
       <p>
        > See the information bulletin of the Finnish Immigration Service
        <a href="https://migri.fi/en/instructions-for-degree-students-with-tuition-fees" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
         Instructions for degree students with tuition fees
        </a>
       </p>
      </blockquote>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Do I have sufficient funds for 2-year permit?
       </strong>
       <br/>
       All Erasmus Mundus scholarship recipients have sufficient funds to be eligible for 2-year residence permit. Self-funded students must have 6 720€ as a bank deposit or other scholarship/grant in order to get 2-year residence permit. In addition, self-funded students need proof of the paid participation fee.
       <a href="https://migri.fi/en/income-requirement-for-students">
        Read more here.
       </a>
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        What shall I put as date of arrival and date of departure from Finland?
       </strong>
       <br/>
       Please arrive to Finland by end of August at the latest. The orientation begins on 26 August 2024.
      </p>
      <p>
       Date of arrival: the date when you intend to arrive to Finland, earliest at the beginning of your study right which is 1st August as stated in the Letter of Admission. But please note that there are no activities on campus before 26 August. In addition, please ensure you have accommodation from your arrival date onwards.
      </p>
      <p>
       Departure date: 2 years from arrival date, for example 26th of August 2026.
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        What is my learner number?
       </strong>
      </p>
      <p>
       You can see your learner number from Studyinfo, where you accepted the admission offer. Although this field is not compulsory, it may help the processing of your application.
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        What should I answer to who has granted the scholarship?
       </strong>
      </p>
      <p>
       The scholarship is granted from outside of Finland by European Commission/ Erasmus Mundus.
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        What is the duration of studies/stay in Finland?
       </strong>
       <br/>
       Two years (the studies include a mobility period to another EU country).
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        What should I answer in “Mobility from Finland to another EU Member State under Directive (EU) 2016/801”
       </strong>
       <br/>
       Please click “My studies are covered by a Union or multilateral programme that comprises mobility measures or by an agreement between two or more higher education institutions.”
      </p>
      <p>
       To the question “During your stay in Finland, do you intend to exercise your right of mobility from Finland to another EU Member State under Directive (EU) 2016/801?” please select YES, and fill in as the name of the programme SECCLO Master’s Programme in Security and Cloud Computing.
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        What should I answer in “Health insurance”? (this will be checked later)
       </strong>
       <br/>
       Your studies last two years, so your insurance needs to cover pharmaceutical costs/medical expenses for up to 40 000 EUR. The Dr. Walter insurance scheme covers all expenses with no deductible, so you can choose “My insurance covers all expenses with no excess”.
      </p>
     </details>
     <p>
      7.
      <strong>
       Apply for accommodation
      </strong>
      .
     </p>
     <blockquote>
      <p>
       > For more information, please see
       <a href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/services/housing-for-students" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        Aalto University’s website
       </a>
      </p>
     </blockquote>
     <p>
      8.
      <strong>
       Organize your travel to Finland
      </strong>
      . New students are expected to arrive to Aalto University Otaniemi Campus by the beginning of the orientation. The orientation week’s programme will be published in June/July and you will receive it by email. You can find more tips for planning your arrival at
      <a href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/international-students/moving-to-finland-and-financial-matters#2-plan-your-arrival-and-first-day-in-finland">
       here
      </a>
      (moving to Finland and financial matters) or
      <a href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/international-students/student-residence-permit-and-health-insurances">
       here (student residence permit and health insurances)
      </a>
     </p>
     <p>
      9.
      <strong>
       Enrol as attending student by paying the Aalto student union (AYY) membership fee.
      </strong>
      We recommend you to take care of the enrolment by 31 July. Enrolling as attending is a precondition for using any Aalto services, getting a student number, and registering for courses. You can enrol at the university after the condition has been fulfilled and the admission is not conditional anymore.
     </p>
     <details>
      <summary>
       >For more information, please click here
      </summary>
      <p>
       To enrol as an attending student at Aalto University after accepting your offer of admission, log in to the OILI service (using the link you received to accept the admission offer) and pay the membership fee of the Aalto University Student Union (AYY).  You can pay the fee with credit card. The fee for academic year 2024-2025 is around 65 €. Online enrolment in OILI is possible until 30 July 2024.
      </p>
      <p>
       If you are unable to enrol as attending in the OILI service, please send a message to secclo(at)aalto.fi. If you pay the membership fee outside Finland, please be prepared to pay foreign transaction charges. The AYY membership fee must be paid in the exact amount.
      </p>
      <blockquote>
       <p>
        > For more information on AYY membership fee, please see
        <a href="https://www.ayy.fi/en/membership-and-student-card/membership-fee" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
         AYY website
        </a>
       </p>
      </blockquote>
     </details>
     <p>
      10.
      <strong>
       Activate your Aalto IT credentials
      </strong>
      (username and email account).
     </p>
     <p>
      You can activate the Aalto University IT account from July onwards after you have enrolled for the academic year and received an activation email. It will be sent to the email address you have used when you applied to SECCLO. Please follow the i
      <a class="external-link" href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/services/activating-an-aalto-user-id" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank">
       nstructions of IT services
      </a>
      and activate your account as soon as possible.
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       You can activate your account at
       <a class="external-link" href="https://salasana.aalto.fi/" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank">
        salasana.aalto.fi
       </a>
       if you have Finnish online banking details, Finnish mobile certificate or a Finnish electronic ID (HST) card.
      </li>
      <li>
       If you don’t have strong identification, you will receive an activation email,
       <a class="external-link" href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/services/how-to-activate-your-user-id-without-strong-authentication" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank">
        please follow these instructions at aalto.fi.
       </a>
       The activation uses the email and the phone number you have used when you applied.
      </li>
      <li>
       If self-activation is not possible, you must visit the
       <a href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/services/it-services">
        IT service desk
       </a>
       to activate your Aalto IT account. Please remember to bring official, photographic ID with you (such as passport).
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      <strong>
       11. Get your student card
      </strong>
     </p>
     <p>
      The student card is proof of your student status and it is the simplest way to get student discounts in, for instance, the university restaurants and public transport. For additional information on the student card go to
      <a class="external-link" href="https://ayy.fi/en/membership-and-student-card" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank">
       the AYY site
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      You can download an
      <a class="external-link" href="https://www.frank.fi/en/" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank">
       electronic student card
      </a>
      for mobile devices, after you have enrolled as an attending student and after your study right has officially started (1 August). The electronic card is accepted in the university restaurants and public transport as proof of student status. The app will ask you for a Finnish ID number but you can leave this field blank if you don’t have one yet.
     </p>
     <p>
      You must enrol as attending by 31 July 2024 at the latest so that the activation is possible when the academic year begins.
     </p>
     <p>
      12.
      <strong>
       Pay the FSHS healthcare fee
      </strong>
     </p>
     <details>
      <summary>
       >For more information, please click here
      </summary>
      <p>
       Students who are registered as attending are entitled to use the services of the
       <a class="external-link" href="http://www.yths.fi/en/frontpage/" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank">
        Finnish Student Health Service (FSHS, Finnish abbreviation YTHS)
       </a>
       and must therefore pay a healthcare fee, which is paid to Kela (The Social Insurance Institution of Finland). You must pay the healthcare fee by 15 November 2024. You can pay the healthcare fee via Kela’s e-service if you have Finnish online banking credentials. Otherwise please check the updated instructions in Kela’s website:
       <a class="external-link" href="https://www.kela.fi/web/en/how-to-pay-the-student-healthcare-fee-in-higher-education" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank">
        How to pay student heathcare fee
       </a>
       .
      </p>
     </details>
     <p>
      13.
      <strong>
       Please follow your email
      </strong>
      for more information about orientation, the start of studies and other practical issues. Please remember to notify us if you change your email address.
     </p>
     <h4>
      <span style="color: #3366ff;">
       Checklist: what to do after arrival to Finland and Aalto University
      </span>
     </h4>
     <p>
      1.
      <strong>
       Arrive to Finland before orientation week
      </strong>
      for new students. In case you have difficulties in arriving to Finland on time due to coronavirus situation, please keep us updated!
     </p>
     <p>
      2.
      <strong>
       Get your keys
      </strong>
      and move in your apartment. Please see
      <a href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/services/housing-for-students#11-tips-for-furnishing-your-apartment" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       Tips for furnishing your apartment
      </a>
      for more information on how to purchase affordable furniture and houseware.
     </p>
     <p>
      3.
      <strong>
       Pay AYY student union membership fee and enrol as attending
      </strong>
      if you haven’t done so already. Students lose their right to study if they have not enrolled by the end of the official enrolment period which is on 1 September 2024.
     </p>
     <p>
      5.
      <strong>
       Attend the orientation week programme
      </strong>
      . (This will be sent to you by email before summer).
     </p>
     <p>
      6.
      <strong>
       Submit your personal study plan (HOPS)
      </strong>
      in Sisu student information system and design your study schedule. Instructions for making your personal study plan will be given during orientation week or before by email.
     </p>
     <p>
      7.
      <strong>
       Register to courses
      </strong>
      that start in period I. Academic year at Aalto University is divided into five periods. For more information, please see
      <a href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/student-guide/academic-calendar" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       Aalto University academic calendar
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      8.
      <em>
       EU/EEA citizens
      </em>
      :
      <a href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/international-students/registering-with-the-authorities-and-opening-a-bank-account#0-register-your-right-of-residence">
       <strong>
        register your residence
       </strong>
      </a>
      at the Finnish Immigration Service (you can get Finnish personal identity code at the same time).
     </p>
     <p>
      9. If you have not received a personal ID-code when applying for a residence permit or when registering as EU-citizen in Finland, you can apply for that at the
      <a href="https://dvv.fi/en/foreigner-registration" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       Digital and Population Data Services Agency
      </a>
      . Send the personal ID-code to us using
      <a href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/cyber-security/encrypting-email-and-files">
       encrypted email
      </a>
      .
     </p>
     <p>
      10.
      <em>
       EM scholarship recipient
      </em>
      :
      <strong>
       open a bank account
      </strong>
      if you do not have a European bank account. For more information on opening a bank account in Finland, please see
      <a href="https://www.aalto.fi/en/international-students/registering-with-the-authorities-and-opening-a-bank-account#4-opening-a-bank-account" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
       Opening a bank account.
      </a>
      Please be prepared that the process may take several weeks.
     </p>
     <p>
      11. Other practicalities after paying the AYY membership fee and enrolling as an attending student:
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="https://www.frank.fi/en/studentcard/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        apply for a student card (Frank card)
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       get a travel card with student discount (HSL card) by visiting
       <a href="https://www.hsl.fi/en/tickets-and-fares/sales-points" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        HSL Service Point
       </a>
       – for this purpose, you need your ID and the Travel Card Application Form for Exchange Students from Aalto University School of Science Student Services.
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://web.lib.aalto.fi/en/forms/asiakas_eng/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        order a library card
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://it.aalto.fi/instructions/changing-password" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        change your Aalto password
       </a>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      <img alt="" class="wp-image-3007 size-full" data-pagespeed-url-hash="1770645968" decoding="async" height="100%" loading="lazy" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" sizes="(max-width: 2016px) 100vw, 2016px" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/09/c872e40e-vappupotretti_pieni.jpg" srcset="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/09/c872e40e-vappupotretti_pieni.jpg 2016w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/09/c872e40e-vappupotretti_pieni-300x225.jpg 300w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/09/c872e40e-vappupotretti_pieni-768x576.jpg 768w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/09/c872e40e-vappupotretti_pieni-1024x768.jpg 1024w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/09/c872e40e-vappupotretti_pieni-700x525.jpg 700w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/09/c872e40e-vappupotretti_pieni-640x480.jpg 640w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/09/c872e40e-vappupotretti_pieni-1600x1200.jpg 1600w" width="100%"/>
      SECCLO students during May Day celebrations 2019, Aalto University Otaniemi Campus
     </p>

     <h3>
      Scholar positions for visiting guest lecturers/academics
     </h3>
     <p>
      The visiting scholars strengthen the academic team of SECCLO. The scholars are invited to contribute to the
      <a href="https://secclo.eu/programme/summer-school/">
       Summer School
      </a>
      , but also to other teaching activities at the consortium member universities. SECCLO scholars may contribute to activities such as:
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Teaching activities in regular courses, guest lectures, workshops and seminar courses
      </li>
      <li>
       Thesis guidance and tutoring of students, supervision and tutoring of doctoral students
      </li>
      <li>
       Development tasks related to SECCLO programme, e.g. teaching content or course evaluations
      </li>
      <li>
       Research activities, working on publications with SECCLO staff
      </li>
      <li>
       Promotion of SECCLO at the scholar’s home university and country
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      A visiting scholar is an academic and/or professional individual of outstanding experience who carries out teaching and research assignments and scholarly work in the institutions participating in the SECCLO programme. A good command of English is required: the language of instruction in the SECCLO is English.
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Scholars can be academics, guest lecturers or researchers from either consortium partner universities or other higher education institutions that do not participate in the consortium
      </li>
      <li>
       Scholars from
       <strong>
        non-academic partners
       </strong>
       can also be invited especially if they contribute in bridging academic and professional content and provide special information / training to the students or have a specific relevant input for the course curriculum.
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h3>
      <strong>
       Scholarships
      </strong>
     </h3>
     <p>
      The scholarship sum is decided by the consortium on a case-by-case basis depending on the length of the visit/online teaching period and if physical mobility (travelling) is included or not.
     </p>
     <h3>
      <strong>
       Timing and length of the scholar activity
      </strong>
     </h3>
     <p>
      <strong>
       The preferred duration for each scholar is a minimum of 4 days (consecutive or not)
      </strong>
      . The length and exact timing of the visit/e-teaching is agreed with the hosting institution organizing the visit/online teaching. .
     </p>
     <p>
      <strong>
       Application and selection procedure
      </strong>
     </p>
     <p>
      The interested scholar candidates are asked to contact the following SECCLO key academics to discuss their areas of expertise and suggest how they could contribute to SECCLO’s teaching and other activities. As the scholar is expected to bring added value to our students, please check our programme curricula here:
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <a href="https://secclo.eu/programme/first-year-curriculum/">
        1st year curriculum
       </a>
      </li>
      <li>
       <a href="https://secclo.eu/programme/second-year-curriculum/">
        2nd year curriculum
       </a>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      Academic contact persons:
     </p>
     <ul>
      <li>
       Aalto: Professor Tuomas Aura
       <em>
        t
       </em>

       </em>
      </li>

        <br/>
       </em>
      </li>
      <li>

       </em>
      </li>
      <li>
       NTNU: Professor Danilo Gligoroski

        <br/>
       </em>
      </li>
      <li>
       UT: Associate Professor Sedat Akleylek
       <em>

       </em>
      </li>
      <li>
       Eurecom: Professor Davide Balzarotti
       <em>
        davide.balzarotti@eurecom.fr
        <br/>
       </em>
      </li>
     </ul>
     <p>
      These academic contact persons will propose a potential candidate to the SECCLO Consortium Committee. If accepted, the scholar candidate will receive a link to an online application form and are expected to submit a CV and a work plan.
     </p>
     <p>
      For further information on the application process, please contact:
     </p>

     </p>

     <h2>
      About us
     </h2>
     <div class="subheader">
     </div>
     <h3>
      2 years, 2 universities, 2 degrees
     </h3>
     <p>
      SECCLO is an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD) programme in information security and cloud computing offered by a consortium of six highly ranked technical universities in Finland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Estonia, and France. During the two-year MSc studies, students will study at two of the consortium universities and graduate from both. Our industry partners promote the future employability of SECCLO students by offering internship and thesis positions, company visits and contributions to the course contents.
     </p>
     <p>
      SECCLO is one of the European top-quality Masters Courses selected by the European Commission Erasmus+ Programme (Erasmus Mundus).
     </p>
     <p>
      <img alt="" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-817" data-pagespeed-url-hash="3140743" decoding="async" height="100%" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2018/10/17857391-shutterstock_623320130.jpg" srcset="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2018/10/17857391-shutterstock_623320130.jpg 1024w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2018/10/17857391-shutterstock_623320130-300x200.jpg 300w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2018/10/17857391-shutterstock_623320130-768x512.jpg 768w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2018/10/17857391-shutterstock_623320130-700x466.jpg 700w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2018/10/17857391-shutterstock_623320130-640x426.jpg 640w" width="100%"/>
     </p>
     <h3>
      Why SECCLO?
     </h3>
     <ul>
      <li>
       <strong>
        Industry demand:
       </strong>
       There is a worldwide shortage of professionals who are able to develop products and services for the modern cloud and mobile computing platforms and to do this in a secure way.
      </li>
      <li>
       <strong>
        Innovation and R&D focus:
       </strong>
       SECCLO differs from most information security programmes in that it links security studies with product and service development skills. The ability to innovate and develop new products and services is what has the most potential for creating new business growth.
      </li>
      <li>
       <strong>
        International experience:
       </strong>
       The programme provides you with the profound experience of working and studying in multiple countries in an international environment. Two Master of Science degrees from two European universities mean wider opportunities for employment while gaining multicultural experience and from the fellow students, a professional network for life.
      </li>
      <li>
       <strong>
        Industry contacts already during studies:
       </strong>
       Mandatory summer internship between first- and second-year studies, industry involvement in courses, and industry thesis projects are some of the examples of how you will be able to gain industry contacts during full-time studies.
      </li>
      <li>
       <strong>
        Competitive Erasmus Mundus scholarships:
       </strong>
       The generous Erasmus Mundus scholarships offered for the best students allow you to concentrate on studies without financial worries.
      </li>
      <li>
       <strong>
        Proven success of our predecessor, NordSecMob:
       </strong>
       Out of over 200 NordSecMob alumni, 95% had landed a job within 6 months after graduation. They work in all the biggest ICT companies, including
       <em>
        Ericsson, Microsoft, Nokia, Google, Facebook, Skype, IBM
       </em>
       , …
      </li>
     </ul>
     <h3>
      <img alt="" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-3085" data-pagespeed-url-hash="3817870229" decoding="async" height="100%" loading="lazy" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" sizes="(max-width: 1200px) 100vw, 1200px" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/09/dc38a8d8-student-secclo-32.jpg" srcset="https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/09/dc38a8d8-student-secclo-32.jpg 1200w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/09/dc38a8d8-student-secclo-32-300x194.jpg 300w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/09/dc38a8d8-student-secclo-32-768x496.jpg 768w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/09/dc38a8d8-student-secclo-32-1024x661.jpg 1024w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/09/dc38a8d8-student-secclo-32-700x452.jpg 700w, https://storage.googleapis.com/secclo-production/2019/09/dc38a8d8-student-secclo-32-640x413.jpg 640w" width="100%"/>
     </h3>
     <h3>
      What SECCLO students say?
     </h3>
     <blockquote>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        “Aalto curriculum was a right mix of practical and theoretical studies. I learned to get work done in smart ways, novel ways for finding solutions, the interactions with other international students broadened the horizons of learning and knowledge sharing.” (Intake 2018)
        <br/>
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        “My first year at Aalto University was great! The courses were well-structured and kept up-to-date with the latest trends in IT security and cloud computing. I had the chance to connect with the IT industry, which gave me valuable hands-on experience and insights. The administration was super helpful and made everything run smoothly. I loved the university’s location – peaceful surroundings close to the buzz of the capital city. And there were plenty of engaging student activities that made my time there even more enjoyable. Overall, it was an amazing experience, and I’m eagerly looking forward to the rest of my studies. (Intake 2022)
        <br/>
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        “The staff is supportive, with everything you need help with, the student culture is outstanding. I am so glad that I made the decision to be part of this programme.” (Intake 2018)
        <br/>
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        “I enjoyed my year a lot here at Aalto University. Every day was full of events at the campus, and I was able to find anything I wanted. English books, gym, language clubs – I had everything for my hobbies. I met so many people with impressive backgrounds and interests during this academic year, so that I can definitely say that I learned a lot from them.” (Intake 2018)
        <br/>
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        “My first year at Aalto has been a cherished one. I’ve had the pleasure of being part of a very diverse and supportive student culture. I made life-long friends from different parts of the world. The faculty members have been incredibly humble and helpful, always willing to go above and beyond to ensure we understand the material. My studies taught me so much about security and how it affects our everyday lives. It’s been a lot of fun, and I’m excited to continue learning and growing as a student in the SECCLO Program.” (Intake 2022)
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        “Taking SECCLO is and will always be the best decision of my life. It transformed me into a totally new, positive and amazing version of mine that I did not even know existed. The academic knowledge and industrial skills you learn from this degree are exceptional and they prepare you to thrive well in the job market. I got to learn so much and got exposed to so many new opportunities and future aspects that I think would not have been possible without SECCLO.” (Intake 2022)
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        “SECCLO first year at Aalto University is an experience that profoundly changes you in a number of ways. World-class academics, great classes, beautiful campus, and the best student life I could ever imagine.” (Intake 2019)
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        “I had an incredibly fulfilling year at Aalto University. The academic experience was exceptional, with a high degree of freedom in choosing courses, and both teachers and classmates were extremely supportive. Moreover, I greatly benefited from SECCLO’s organizing various activities that enriched our learning journey. Student discounts were available at various places, including gyms and restaurants, making life more affordable. Access to healthcare was made easy through YTHS, facilitating visits to doctors when needed.” (Intake 2022)
       </span>
      </p>
      <p>
       <span style="color: #808080;">
        “The first year as a SECCLO student in Aalto University teaches students the foundations of secure and scalable systems with a hands-on approach. This provides insight for choosing a second year specialization track, where you can further develop your skills in the areas that interest you the most. Aalto University provides an excellent atmosphere for learning, and tools that enable you to excel at your studies”. (Intake 2019)
       </span>
      </p>
     </blockquote>
    </div>
   </div>

  <style type="text/css">
   /* HEADINGS ETC. */
		a,
		.container-fluid h1, 
		.container-fluid h2, 
		.container-fluid h3, 
		.container-fluid h4, 
		.container-fluid h5 {
			color:#ffffff !important;
		}
		a:hover,a:active {
			color:#f7f7f7;
		}
		.section-title {
			border-bottom: 2px solid #ffffff;
		}
		.subheader {
			color:#f7f7f7		}

		/* HEADER */
		.header-sub {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);   
		}
		.header-mob {
	       background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%); 
		}
		
		/* PARTNERS */
		.partners {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);			
		}
		.partners h2, 
		.partners h3, 
		.partners h4, 
		.partners h5 {
			color:#00c1d5;
			border-color:#00c1d5;
		} 
		.partners.white_bg {
			background:#fff;
		}
		.partners.white_bg h2, 
		.partners.white_bg h3, 
		.partners.white_bg h4, 
		.partners.white_bg h5 {
			color: #ffffff;
			border-color: #ffffff;
		}
		/* GRADIENT BLOCKS */
		.gradient-bg {
			background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);
			color:#fff;
		}
		.gradient-bg h1,
		.gradient-bg h2,
		.gradient-bg h3, 
		.gradient-bg h4,
		.gradient-bg h5,
		.gradient-bg a {
			color:#00c1d5;
			border-color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.gradient-bg .btn {
			color: #00c1d5;
			border: 2px solid #00c1d5;
		}

		/* HERO */
		.hero {
			background-image: url('../img/glider.jpg');
		}
		.hero-content h1, 
		.hero-content a, 
		.hero-content-mob h1 {
			color:#00c1d5 !important; 
		}
		.hero-content-mob p {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.hero-content {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.hero-content .btn, 
		.hero-content-mob .btn {
			border:2px solid #00c1d5;
			color:#00c1d5 !important;

		}
		.navbar-header a {
			color: #00c1d5; 
		}
		.hero .copyright {
			color: #f0f0f0;
		}
		.hero-content-wrapper {
			background: rgba(255,255,255,0.6);
		}
		.hero-content-mob {
			background: linear-gradient(75deg, #ffffff 10%, #ffffff 90%);   
		}

		/* NAV */
		.container-fluid .nav>li>a:hover, 
		.container-fluid .nav>li>a:focus,
		.container-fluid .nav li a:hover, 
		.container-fluid .nav li a:active, 
		.nav li a:focus {
			background:rgba(255,255,255,0.2);
		}
		.icon-bar {
			background: #00c1d5;
		}
		.top-nav {
			background: #f7f7f7;
		}
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a,
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a:hover,
		.container-fluid .nav .open>a:focus {
			background:rgba(255,255,255,0.2);
		}
		.top-nav .nav li a,
		.top-nav .navbar-brand {
			color:#00c1d5 !important;

		}
		.top-nav .container-fluid .nav li a:hover {
			color:#00c1d5;
		}
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu .active a,
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu .active a:hover {
			background: #efefef;
		}
		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li:active,
		.dropdown-menu li.current-menu-item,
		.dropdown-menu, .dropdown-menu li {
			background: #efefef;
		}
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a:hover,
		.top-nav .dropdown-menu li:active a:hover {
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}

		.btn.btn-primary {
			background-color:#ffffff;
			color:#00c1d5 !important;
		}
		.btn.btn-primary:hover {
			background-color:#f7f7f7;
		}
		footer {
			background: #00c1d5;
		}
		.nav .open a {
			background: #f7f7f7;
		}
		@media only screen and (max-width: 767px) {

			.top-nav .dropdown-menu {
				background: #efefef;
			}
			.top-nav .dropdown-menu li a {
				background:transparent;
			}
		}

		/* Product title */
		.product-title__secondary-title {
			color: #ffffff;
		}
  </style>
